Eternity Orb: This unit’s remaining mana at the end of a round is stored in this items (To be added next battle).
Stop Sign: Whenever a unit uses their ability they are stunned for 2 seconds.
Gumball Machine: Attacks have a chance to spawn a collectible (e.g. Coins, Experience, Items and Potions).
Arcanist’s Cube: This character casts a random ability instead of their own when they reach maximum mana.
 Special single use potions.Sometimes you’re deep into a run and, despite your best efforts, you’re thrown up against a seemingly impossible fight. Potions can help you turn the tide of the battle in your favour, or give you an extra push to take down a difficult boss without losing any health at all. We have tons of ideas for potions but here’s a few to get your mouth watering;
Shrink Elixir : Reduces an enemy’s level.
Vial of Dragon’s Breath: Double’s an ally’s attack speed this round.
Mini Mana Font: Gives an ally 50% of their maximum mana this round.
Medusa’s Tears: Turns an enemy to stone for the first 3 seconds of the round. 
 Experience a new adventure every time with randomly generated maps, enemies and boss combinations. Connor -- Lead Developer/Designer. Can usually be found either making or playing a video game, other endeavors seem pointless. He will be responsible for coding the underlying combat systems and designing the character abilities/items in the game.Favourite Games: Kirby Super Star, League of Legends, Binding of Isaac, Realm of the Mad God‘I’ve been working on games of all shapes and sizes for… professionally just over 5 years… but to be honest I was making card games on the back of cereal boxes when I was 8 years old.’  Tom -- Lead ArtistThe guy that attempts to make things look nice. He appreciates all the art forms but especially game art. He probably wouldn't have chosen a career in it if he didn't. He used to love playing games but now doesn't get the chance since acquiring a baby daughter who consumes all his time. Proficient at 3D art but terrible at 2D, which probably doesn't need drawing attention to.Favourite Games: Guild Wars 2, most GTA's, Ocarina of Time, Skyrim, modded Minecraft, Dota 2“If only I knew what I was doing!” Joey -- Gameplay DeveloperLikes to play video games and guitar, and makes games and VR experiences professionally. He's got a few years programming experience, but more importantly a LOT of years coffee drinking and eyebrow furrowing experience. His job on Auto Blobs mainly involves UI and Combat interface implementation and design.Favourite Games: Transistor, XCOM 2, Mount and Blade, Darkest Dungeon, Borderlands“Hey, it would be nice if you could come up with a quote for yourself - Someone that isn't Joey“ Adrian -- Boss ManBloke that founded the company and makes sure the bills get paid. Knows a thing or two about making video games, has been doing it since he was 10 years old - which if we told you how old he was you'd see is a very long time.Favourite Games: Age of Empires, Monkey Island, Counter-Strike and Dungeon Master"I promise to stop the arm falling off my office chair if this project gets proper money" Find us in all of these lovely places!Looking forward to hearing from you!Even more variety in each run with an extra 2 worlds. And once again, you’ll be deciding which ones through a Discord vote!We think this game would fit right in on Switch. We want to play it on the.. Uh.. Train.. Don’t you?5 more mini-game events - Even more variety in each run with an extra 10 mini-games. And better yet, you’ll be deciding which ones through a Discord vote!Help our items come to life! With 3D items your blobs can hold a sword a staff and wear plate armor, hold 3 swords or better yet, wear 3 different hats.Design your own puzzle levels and upload them to our database to share them to the Auto Blobs community. Our very own Super Blobio Maker.Currently we’ve been developing Auto Blobs in evenings and weekends as a passion project. Meeting this goal would allow us to work on it full time, and let it reach its full potential.As well as supporting us, funding would allow us to hire 2D artists for the user interface and animators for our blobs in combat. Both would be a massive level up for the game’s visuals!Ultimately, the more interest and support we receive the more items, enemies, events and modes we can add.. So the better the game will be!Even if you can’t help fund us, or you want to do more, sharing this page with your friends or community, talking about it, or even joining our Discord and giving us your ideas are all great ways to help us bring this idea to life! We really want to know what you think, help us make the Auto Blobs you want to play!

story:
*New rewards are being unlocked by the community as we progress along the stretch goals*

   Leecher is a 2D multigenre side scroller game with complex physics based mechanics. 

   Inspired by games like Trine and Limbo, Leecher will keep two core principles to its end: puzzle solving and one punch death. 

   As for the rest, the gameplay will entirely depend on its six progress stages.  

   At each stage you will have to master a new character that has its own unique mechanics and a different scheme of visual perception.

   The action takes place in the distant future on a faraway planet. For a long time its climate remained unchanged, that allowed for evolution to flourish. Many bizarre creatures emerged.  

   You are one of them - a symbiote that is able to connect to the central nervous system of other organisms. The nature arround you is unstable so you have to start a long wander through the unnown places and substances in order to find a new home... 

   It is the leecher, who creates the logic of characters changes.

   You will witness through the eyes of different creatures how the emergence of such an organism as a leecher imprinted on the evolution of all living beings and humanoids community.

   You will face the force that shattered the fragile structure of the planetary ecosystem and brought it into motion.

"The Climber"  

   This creature is a terrestrial being that is able to jump onto ceilings and walls and climb on or up them. The gameplay will test your reaction and the ability to solve spatial tasks of low and medium complexity.  

It has a simple black and white vision with lowered level of detail.  

“The Crowd Fish"  

   It is an aquatic being. The mechanics of this character are based on the interaction with the fish shoal. You will have to be very observant and watch the behavior of other fishes to know when the shoal is ready to follow your actions, and when it is frightened. By ignoring its state and sacrificing your comrades in vain, you will significantly complicate advancing to further levels.  

It has a full color vision with the emphasis on the shoal insight and with a distortion of the above-water space.  

 “The Bat"  

   This character is volant and belongs to the most dynamic part of the game. You will struggle with gravity and hunt on various fauna specimen .  

This creature has a high contrast vision with low depth of field and a threats color differentiation.  

“The Cow"  

   A terrestrial being that can walk, lie down, and chew. Primarily, it is needded for a slight relaxation.  

Its vision has saturated colors with a tilted balance.  

“The Colony Master”  

   It is a subterranean being that can’t move by itself, but has an ability to control a colony of giant insects. Various classes of units will be at your disposal. It would be up to you to decide which units to raise, how to defend and what to conquer. This character will add real-time strategy elements of “rock-paper-scissors” classical type.  

This characters display area will have a “friend-foe” color identification and a fuzzy projection of orders and actions.  

“The Spider”  

   It is a terrestrial being. Its gaming stage will contain the highest number of puzzles. The mechanics features the ability to use the web to move, interact with objects and create complex spatial constructions.  

The creature is able to see low-frequency radiation.

   As a rule, stretch goals are accompanied with additional game content (new levels, weapons, characters, monsters, etc.). Having studied a great number of projects, I noticed that this extension is not always beneficial.  

   So I decided that I wouldn’t risk the quality of the game by promising the content I'm not certain about.  

   However, the selected model of the campaign engenders the condition under the fulfillment of which the release of the game might undergo a minor modification - if the raised funds are less than 132k the game will be created in two chapters and will be delivered with a time gap.  

   The structure of the rewards has also undergone changes. Now new rewards are being unlocked as we progress along the stretch goals. Digital rewards will be offered to ALL backers. Physical and creative rewards will be given only to those who choose the respective tier.

$8,000 - The Goal of Interest. The first chapter of the game will be done. We will strengthen the team and will keep the active development for several months. We will be looking for a publisher at the same time. Also, opens creative reward tiers. 

  • $12,000 - Poster [Physical]. Opens a "Physical Poster" reward tier.  
  • $16,000 - Wallpapers pack [Digital]. Set of 12 exclusive bakers only hi-res wallpapers for your desktop.
  • $20,000 - Concept Art Book [Digital + Physical]. All of our best and interesting concepts collected in a PDF file. Also, opens a "Physical Concept Art Book" reward tier.
  • $24,000 - Soundtrack [Digital]. Original game soundtrack which will reflect all the game stages.
  • $28,000 - Characters 3d models pack [Digital]. 3 printable 3D models of main characters saved in STL files.
  • $32,000 - Cursor Pack [Digital]. Set of four stylized cursors for your computer.
  • $36,000 - Monsters 3d models [Digital]. 6 printable 3D models of monsters saved in STL files.
  • $40,000 Mobile theme and SFX Pack [Digital]. A special theme (Android / iOS) and a set of carefully recorded game sounds for you to fill your phone a living creature. 
  • $44,000 - Scene Assets [Digital]. One of the game scenes saved in the open for edit unipack format. You will be able to look at the game from inside, figure out how it actually works and do whatever you want with the received files.

$48,000 - The Goal of Independency. We will not need a publisher at this amount. You will get instant access to a closed Facebook group where you will be able to leave feedback, share suggestions, take part in surveys, evaluate new game assets and contact me personally. You'll also be amongst the first to play the game. And instead of the typical Intro with the logo of the publisher we will create our own stylized one with names of everyone who contributed to the game creation and gratitude to the Indiegogo Project for the support.

  • $60,000 - Wallpapers second pack [Digital]. Additional set of 12 more hi-res wallpapers for your desktop.
  • $72,000 - Devplaybox Pack [Digital]. You get all the fun that was in the development of Leecher. You’ll have access to unique testing grounds where you will be able to twist the levers that are accessible to developers only. For example, you’ll be able to play with the swarm from the scene with the hive. The Devplaybox Pack includes three different stand-alone applications for PC, Mac, and Linux.
  • $84,000 - Observer’s Journal [Digital + Physical]. A short story of the research unit whose spaceship landed on the leecher's home world planet. The narration will be done in the form of an interplanetary engineer’s desultory records written in his diary. It also opens a "Physical Observer’s Journal" reward tier.
  • $96,000 - 3d models bundle [Digital]. Additional 9 (3 character's and 6 monster's) printable 3d models saved in STL files.  
  • $108,000 - Naturalist's journal [Digital + Physical]. It contains only accepted concept arts of monsters and characters as well as their in-game descriptions. It also opens a "Physical Naturalist Journal" reward tier.
  • $120,000 - Archers Minigame [Digital]. The complete bakers only mini-game consisting of in-game and specially designed assets. It will be a standalone application for PC Mac Linux. Genre - score shooter.

$132,000 - The Goal of Perfection. The game will get the initially intended form - a complete story, six characters and no division into parts.

Borys Koreniev - Creator, programmer, acting animator. 

   I am a coder to the marrow of my bones. Before I discovered programming I had been keen on anatomy, neurobiology, physics, and chemistry. In general, I tried to learn everything about everything. My diverse interests are reflected in the game.

Alexander Parafeinik - 2D artist (behance)

   He has a superhuman patience and a flexible creative mind. He is confident and convinced that any idea can shine if you exert enough effort.

   It was he who came up with a brilliant and simple idea to build a game environment from dozens of layers. This gave us the desired sense of volume and considerable savings of GPU resources compared to the analogous 3D environment.

Vitaliy Shved - 3d artist (sketchfab)

   When he is resting from the creation of the models for his basic work, he creates models for Dota 2. He has joined the team quite recently and immediately impressed us with his vast experience and solid knowledge of the case.

Molo Dimolo -  Composer (website)

   It seems that he hears a lot more than I do. It’s as if another dimension has been opened for his perception.

   Formerly I had some doubts about him. The reason was the specifics of his portfolio. He has a bunch of awesome compositions but none in dark ambient style. I told him about my uncertainty and he replied: "Just let my try.” The result is well known. He is part of the team now!

   All basic scripts have already been finished (those in charge of the main menu, cameras, systems of re-spawn, saving and loading, systems of dynamic scenes uploading).  

   For the first character: level design and coding has been completed and locations styles have been defined.

   Full work on the mechanics of the second character has been started. 

Character 1 - Jumpability Test

Camera Spline Demonstration

Arrow Test

   Primary release is planned for Windows, Mac and Linux. The delivery will be via Steam and GOG.

   Also in perspective, we have ambitions to launch on PlayStation and Xbox.

Risks and challenges

   While choosing a multi-genre concept I thought not only about how to make the gameplay varied, and the story holistic, but I also thought about us as a team of developers. I wanted the game to give us an opportunity for professional growth.

   That is why the game has such a diversity in mechanics and visuals. It supposed to become a big and interesting challenge for us, but at the same time, there is basically nothing we could not cope with. 

   However, our development plan has one vulnerability. It is trivially an amount of work. Especially in terms of locations design. For this reason, the first thing we will do after fundraising is to expand and strengthen the team. I have already made a list of people who I am going contact and bring on board so we can deliver the game on time.

   Thank you for reading and thanks to all who have been supporting our endeavors so far!

P.S. I tried to be as laconic as I could. Therefore, lots of information were removed from the campaign text. Ask me any questions and I will fill the gaps in further updates.

story:
About this project

Have you ever played 2048 puzzle game? Well we have and we saw so much more potential in this exciting game! And this project is the effort to realize what we have envisioned as a new simple yet engaging puzzle game inspired by 2048.

In monster square, we maintain the simple and direct game play experience yet at the same time we introduce much more depth in strategy, goal orientation and rewards of the game itself.

A standard board for is 4x4, We are introducing a 4x5 board to the game with added twist to engage players in a different game experience. 

Instead of numbers, we use monsters and evolution phases to enhance game experience. What's more exciting is that the monsters are collectibles through completion of requirements. We encourage players to go and unlock the many different monsters available in game. Each monster type has 12 levels of progression.

We are introducing objective and stages into the game. With this, player does not only strive for higher points, at the same time player has to think of different strategies to complete the requirements on each stages.

We are introducing obstacles to the game for more excitement! There are many obstacles with different attributes and effects that will disturb the movement or progression of the monster on the board.

To balance out the obstacle, we created monster canon. This can help players remove status effects, level up their monsters and eliminate obstacles. The canon is charged with combo points until it's ready to be triggered.

Share your high scores with your friends on your social network! 

The first phase of the game will be released solely on Android, as free to play.

 Goals note:

Time Attack mode: Unlock time attack game play mode aside from normal mode.

Extreme Survival mode: Unlock survival mode where we will include all the chances of obstacles appearing during game.

Monster Skills: It has been our ambitious plan to include this big feature where all the monsters set will have specific unique skills to help players in game.

Risks and challenges

First challenge is resources. Though we have nearly completed all the main features in the game, we have exhausted much of our resources and will struggle in the long run to maintain continuous improvement and upgrades for the game after release. We are looking to increase our team in order to make continuity possible.

Second challenge is publishing. Since this is the first game that we release, we will need to increase exposure through marketing means. This will require more funding.

We believe that the future of gaming is the exploration of deeper experience while maintaining simplicity in order to reach a wider range of player. This project is our effort to make this come true. Right here, your sincere support is what we need!

story:
About Us

We are a Bulgarian team of software developers and artists. 

In the beginning we were just a few developers winning multiple national software development competitions, as well as NASA Space Apps Challenge 2013 (the largest hackathon on the Earth with 9000 participants), and reached top 5 at NASA Space Apps Challenge 2014. This was the time we realised that we really want to work on games. It was then when we found and teamed with some great artists and now we are working on our first game - Animals at War.

Why Indiegogo

We are small indie team with just 5 team members. We know how to develop great applications and we just need a little financial push to complete our project. But we also want to validate our idea and get a feedback for our work. So far we have invested our own money developing and popularizing Animals at War and we have our working prototype. We’ve got a great feedback and a demand for more content and visual improvements which requires more than we can spend. This is why we hope you like our game and support us. To be honest this is our first commercial project and succeeding with it will also greatly boost our motivation for future development.

The Game

In an alternative world where all animals have evolved together into extremely intelligent creatures, inevitably the war for superiority has begun...

Those animals have a lot in common with their relatives from our world. The cats are not very reliable - always doing what they want, the dogs - masters of following orders (even huskies sometimes do that too) etc. So choose a side that best suits you and get in the game.

gameAnimals at War is a turn-based card game. We want to create games that make you think and you can play with your friends. A card game is fitting great in that conception. We also had the following criteria:

  • fast game (no more than 5 mins, so you can play while you are waiting for the bus or while you are doing your royal business)
  • simple rules
  • competitive scenarios
  • screw your friend scenarios
  • mobile(there are not many mobile multiplayer games where you can play 1v1 with your friends and we wanted to create something in that direction)

And we think we got the formula that matches. The rules of Animals at War are extremely easy to explain. In fact lets explain them – so we have 3 types of cards – Characters, Upgrades and Events. In order to play those, you have to pay their food cost. You play Characters or Upgrade cards and then switch turns with your opponent and play Event cards until you both pass. Then your opponent can play Characters or Upgrade cards and then… well you got the point. Upgrades give you passive effects like food per round or increased damage, Characters attack your opponent and Event cards boost the attacks or reduce their effect. You win the game by either killing your opponent or gaining enough alliance which automatically wins the game for you. And that sums it up.

Quite simple rules but got enough options for interesting effects and combinations with 3 types of cards and 2 winning conditions so that the game can be interesting and more competitive.

What do we plan to do next

Currently, we’ve got a prototype of the game that you can try. We’ve got the cats and the dogs as playable factions with about 20 cards. Our goal is to release the game with 4 factions – cats, dogs, mice, monkeys and 200 cards (40 per faction and 40 neutral). This will give enough options for deck building (usually you play a game with 10 cards). Of course, we can’t handle all the expenses for art, sound, servers etc, so this is why we ask for your help. We would love to see more factions, 4 players games, singleplayer campaigns, themed expansion sets, etc and we got ideas for all of that but everything depends on the funds we raise and your suggestions.

We already received a lot of feedback and we are trying to do our best to take everything into consideration. If you have any ideas or just want to have a chat about the game, don’t hesitate to  give us a call.

Game art (in progress)

Dogs

Cats

Animals at Wars rules

Stretch Goals

           

Perks

All contributors will get an early beta access to the game.

Where your money will go

Risk and Challenges

We know how to develop and release Animals at War. Our main challenge will be the marketing of the game and getting a critical player base. But having your support will solve partly this problem. However, we will invest part of the money received from this campaign and add funding from ourselves to guarantee that whenever you play the game - there will be an opponent for you.

We do not have much experience with creating sound for games and this is why we will work with external company on this.

This was the time we realised that we really want to work on games. It was then when we found and teamed with some great artists and now we are working on our first game - Animals at War.Why IndiegogoWe are small indie team with just 5 team members. We know how to develop great applications and we just need a little financial push to complete our project. But we also want to validate our idea and get a feedback for our work. So far we have invested our own money developing and popularizing Animals at War and we have our working prototype. We’ve got a great feedback and a demand for more content and visual improvements which requires more than we can spend. This is why we hope you like our game and support us. To be honest this is our first commercial project and succeeding with it will also greatly boost our motivation for future development.The GameIn an alternative world where all animals have evolved together into extremely intelligent creatures, inevitably the war for superiority has begun...Those animals have a lot in common with their relatives from our world. story:
>>CLICK HERE TO GET THE DEMO!<<

Note: This is a demo of a game in production so it will definitely have a few bugs, sorry for the inconvenience. If you find any please report it so I can fix it. The demo will be updated during the campaign, fixing bugs and changing according to player feedback so don't be shy to leave your  constructive comments.

 

FISH is first person shooter with old-school gameplay inspired by games like DOOM, Duke Nukem 3D and Quake. It has handcrafted levels with non-linear structures and secrets, like we used to have in the 90s. And here's the hook:

 

Literally, you have a hook that can be used to travel the map and pull stuff.

And the enemies are fishmen. Not any fishmen, they're pirate fishmen! Captain Black Whiskers and his crew have taken over the tropical island of San Esteban, all seemed lost until a hero showed up to help the resistance: The Pescador! A strong,hairy and shirtless fisherman with a hook in his right hand and an unknown past. With his (and your) help, the resistance can defeat the pirates and take the island back!

Aside from the classic 90's FPS, FISH also takes a lot of inspiration from pirate movies, One Piece and a brazillian soap opera from the early 2000's called Kubanacan.

 

 

Good question. I'm Arthur "Tuba" Zeferino, I'm a huge fan of 90's classic FPS and I want to help bringing back the FPS genre to it's roots. Anyway, I've been working with games in Brazil since 2008, working as a programmer on a bunch of simpler games like The Three Stooges: Treasure Hunt Hijinks and Satisfashion DS. A few years ago I decided I should work on a game that I would want to play and so here I am. 

I'm also one of the founders of the brazilian gaming website GAMESFODA and spent the last few years writing reviews and articles about games and game design. If you don't speak portuguese and want to know some of that work, check these game design articles I've wrote for Gamasutra:

The Influences and Differences of Team Fortress 2 Classes and Overwatch Heroes
The storytelling in Undertale's combat system

 

And this video about Quake's E1M3 level design (turn the captions on for english):

 

 

But I can understand if that's not enough for you to trust me with your money, that's why I have a demo. Check it out and decide for yourself!

 

 

- Old school action! Lots of bullets hitting stuff, exploding barrels, big enemies and all that good stuff.

- A hookshot! It can be used to travel the map, pull enemies and items and some other cool stuff.

- Exploration! Remember having to explore the maps in DOOM? Remember finding those sweet secret areas and levels? I hope you like that because we're doing it here.

- Dynamic soundtrack full of rhythm! FISH's soundtrack changes according to the action on the screen and is being composed by the talented guys at Cafofo Studio in Rio, it's a mix of jazz and samba, giving the game an unique feeling. 

- Cartoony artstyle mixing 2D and 3D. Miss sprites? We have that! Like 3D graphics? We have that too! And also, colors! Lots of them!

- Humor! FISH is supposed to be fun, so don't take it seriously, enjoy the jokes and the violence against fishmen pirates!

- Unreal Engine 4 - FISH is being developed using the noble and pedigreed middleware from Epic Games.

 

The story is not the focus in FISH, in fact it's totally skippable if you prefer. But there are a few characters to add some flavor to the game:

 

No one knows where he came from and he doesn't remember either. Only known as The Pescador (the fisherman), Rubí found him stranded at a beach and helped him recover. He's very skillful with firearms and his hook can absorb power from fishmen scales. Don't like wearing shirts.

 

The leader of the resistance, a woman in her 60s, respected by everyone and kinda cranky. She found the Pescador lost at the beach and took care of him, a mother figure of some sorts. Now she's responsible to think about strategies and send him in missions. Curses a lot.

 

A mad scientist that help the fishmen with her technology, as long as the Captain allow her to continue with her researches. The only human that Black Whiskers respect.

 

An old ruthless pirate that sees the humans as an inferior species. No one knows he's true intentions on the island.

 

Black Whiskers' very large crew. Has some of the most peculiar and dangerous pirates of any species.

 

I've been cooking fish for many years now. A lot of people have ate my fish and all of them survived [citation needed]. So not only I'm sharing some spicy details about the game development, but I'm sharing all my special fish recipes! Tuna, cod, sardines, salmon, anchovies and many others! Fried, grilled, boiled, spicy, raw, sweet, sour, rotten, you'll become a fish cooking master chef in no time with great recipes like this one:

 

Grilled sardine:

Ingredients:

  • Fresh sardine
  •  Thyme
  •  Rosemary
  •  Black Pepper
  •  Salt

 

Prepare:

Season the sardines with all the ingredients mentioned (except the sardine itself, that doesn't even make sense) and let the flavors sink in for about an hour.

Light up your grill or frying pan until it's very hot, add a little olive oil so your fish don't stick and put the sardines with the skin facing down. The exact time depends on your equipment but since this is a small fish, it should be quick. Turn it over when the meat gets all whitish, leave it for a few more minutes to get some color and it's done!

Eat. 

*Ilustration by Shana Ximenes

 

Sadly, music is an often overlooked (overheard?) part of a game. But here we take it very seriously. The music is being composed side by side with the game's development by the talented fellows at Cafofo Studio, it's a mix of samba-rock and bebop jazz, rhythms that are not heard in games very often.

Listen:

Yeah, I'm not doing stretch goals. I can't promise more levels, console versions or anything like that because that wouldn't require just more money but also more time. So any extra money will be put into hiring freelancers to help with the game, getting better equipment for development, hiring voice actors and things like that to make sure we can deliver the best possible product to you;

 

The Art/Cookbook - Details above, but basically it's art-book AND a cook-book with some seafood recipes! 

 

 

Poster - This beautiful poster, in printed and digital formats.  Art by Bruno Atanazio.

 

Your Fishsona! - Ever wondered how would you look as a fish? Well, I can draw that for you. You can also be a crustacean, your call.

 

You somewhere in the game! - The island of San Esteban is full of buildings and these buildings are full of pictures, paintings, magazines and other stuff with people printed on them. And you can be one of those people! As a person or as a fish, why not?

 

Boxed copy of FISH - Yep, you can get a boxed copy of FISH! With manuals and stuff! Just like they used to do in the old days. Don't worry, you'll get a digital copy too and won't have to wait for your game to arrive like we used to do in the old days.

 

Every future game from 8AH - Thanks for believing in the future of my one man studio, that's a big gamble, so you get every game I make from now on! In a way you're an investor... sounds important.

 

Arthur Zeferino is about to make you his fish - You're invited to come here and check my recipes for yourself*.

*Not paying for your travel expenses unless this campaign surpasses the goal by A LOT.... well, stranger things have happened.

Physical rewards will be delivered later, after the game's launch.

 

I'll be honest with you, it's basically a one man team here and it's the first time I'm doing something this big. With your help I'll have enough money to hire some good professionals to help me but there's still a lot I don't know. February/2019 is when I believe I can finish the game the way I want, but it might take a little more time, what I can promise is to keep you all updated of the progress and to make the best game I can.

 

Q. I wanna help but I'm short on cash, what can I do?

A. Thanks for your consideration but keep your money. Tell about the game to your friends, share this page on your social networks, that helps a lot.

 

Q. No console version? :(

A. First we want to focus on the best game possible that can be played on a PC/Mac/Linux because that's where most DOOM and Quake fans are. But I would love to port it to consoles, all of them.

 

Q. So no controller support on PC?

A. FISH has full controller support on PC, we're making sure that players who prefer to play it like that can also enjoy the game.

 

Q. 2019? Really?

A. These things take time and I wanna make sure you're getting the best possible product. But I'll keep you updated.

 

Q. How many maps will this thing have?

A. 16 (with some secret ones).

 

Q. Will FISH have multiplayer?

A. No. Sorry, but making a single player mode is already a lot of work and I want to focus on that. But the good news is that there are plenty of good new FPS with multiplayer out there, have you played DOOM? Quake Champions? DUSK? Lawbreakers?  Unreal Tournament 4? They're cool.

 

Q. Why IndieGogo?

A. Honest answer? Because the competition doesn't accept projects from Brazil.

 

Q. If you're from Brazil, Why not use a brazillian service that use BRL as currency?

A. Great question. As you can see by the language being used here, I'm not making a game just for brazillian fellows but for the whole world. Brazilian services are quite restricted and by choosing Indiegogo, FPS fans from the whole world can help. Anyway, if you're brazilian (or american or from anywhere actually) and you can't afford an international credit card or a paypal account, you can still help by sharing the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or social network of your preference, tell your friends about it! Use that money to buy some milk, a sandwich or some sardines and do the recipe above, enjoy yourself! 

 

Q. I'm not brazilian and I've heard there are some brazilian pop culture references in it. Will I be able to enjoy it?

A. Yes. FISH has indeed a lot of brazilian pop culture references but I'm trying to make something that everyone can enjoy. So, there'll be adaptations to the most obscure references in every language, don't worry about it.

 

Q. I'm vegan, can I still enjoy the artcookbook?

A. Yes! You can look at the pretty pictures, use it to hold your door, use it as a cup mat, it has many functions!! Also, there will be some vegan fish recipes in there. What's a vegan fish? I don't know, but I'll look into it and tell you all about it in the book!

 

Q. Why all the jokes?

A. I'm nervous.

story:
About the game 

Story:
The idea was to create a game wich can improve multitasking and concentration skills on a funny way, so winged wheels has come to life.

Rules: 
In this game you control a spaceship on the left side of the screen and avoid the alien monsters but at the same time you control a car on the right side and collect the coins to earn high scores. 

When you hit an alien with the ship or miss a coin with the car you lose life. At 0 life point the game is over. 

As you progress the game becomes harder and harder. 

Goal:
The goal is to earn as high score as possible. There are also hidden achievements wich will lead you to other vehicles. for example if you menage to earn 100 coin in a single round you can choose another car to go on adventure with. 

Controls:
To control the spaceship you use the A and D keys on the keyboard and for the car you can use the Left and Right arrow keys. High level of concentration requaired.


 The first car called Emerald

 

 The Aliens

 

 The first Spaceship called Zaphyr

Scope of the foundraising

Every project comes with its prices, with this 1000$ we can release Winged Wheels and with affordable game engines and graphics softwares we will be able to create a lot more indie games like this, and we can finally fulfill our dream and become game developers ^^ 

Founders may gain acces to our closed beta testing period where you can try out Winged Wheels ^^

Other ways you can help

If you can not donate but you still like our game, you can still help by telling a friend and sharing us on social media. Every little help counts and you will have our everlasting gratitude :) 

 

If the foundraising succeeds the game will be 100% free to play :)

At 0 life point the game is over. As you progress the game becomes harder and harder. Goal:The goal is to earn as high score as possible. There are also hidden achievements wich will lead you to other vehicles. for example if you menage to earn 100 coin in a single round you can choose another car to go on adventure with. Controls:To control the spaceship you use the A and D keys on the keyboard and for the car you can use the Left and Right arrow keys. High level of concentration requaired. The first car called Emerald  The Aliens  The first Spaceship called ZaphyrScope of the foundraisingEvery project comes with its prices, with this 1000$ we can release Winged Wheels and with affordable game engines and graphics softwares we will be able to create a lot more indie games like this, and we can finally fulfill our dream and become game developers ^^ Founders may gain acces to our closed beta testing period where you can try out Winged Wheels ^^Other ways you can helpIf you can not donate but you still like our game, you can still help by telling a friend and sharing us on social media. Every little help counts and you will have our everlasting gratitude :)  If the foundraising succeeds the game will be 100% free to play :)

story:
Axis Forward

I solo developed the game using Unity 5.

It is currently in the Google Play Store.

I need funding to purchase an iMac computer to develop for iPhone and to purchase a few old iPhones and Tablets for testing.

Also need funding to acquire an iPhone Developers Account.

Any additional funding will be used for Marketing and Promotion.

 

The Game Is Ready

Unity makes it simple to use my existing code and resources to publish to iPhone.

The only caveat is that I have to do it on a Mac.

Once I have the necessary hardware, the game should be publishable on iPhone in a few weeks.

 

Labor Of Love

It's great to finally discover what you want to do with your life.

Unfortunately, just as money cannot buy you happiness, being happy does not get you money.

Simply put, I need help.

story:
Bring Sagas to Life!

Sagas a new live action roleplaying game and this funding supports the occurrence of the Open Beta event October 16-18, 2015 in Vernon, NJ by securing venue rental, insurance, and basic supplies.

2015 marks the 30th anniversary of the Evindale fantasy RPG setting and we'd like to bring it to life with a new, lightweight rules system made specifically for live action roleplay.

What is the setting?

Sagas is set in the dying world of Evindale, in the tribal,nation of Sta'abri.  Surrounded by the remnants of civilizations destroyed by a cataclysmic event known as the Interregnum, the tribes of Sta'abri fared both better and worse than their neighbors.

Unlike others who relied upon now-dead gods, the people of Sta'abri returned to their roots and sought power and assistance from the underlying force behind all life: the eight Elements.  They were not the only one to do so, however.

"Incursion" finds you, the cast character, as a representative of one of four tribes -- the healing Water-based River Elk, the violent Fire-fueled Dead Claw, the deadly Moon-powered Snow Leopards, or the oracular Sun-fed White Bison -- who have come together to discuss their future against the Sadrith Mar, an invading force of slavers who may have found the secret of uniting (or destroying) the Elements.

With the Mar on your heels, the tribes must work together to survive.  Even as you meet, scouts of the Mar head your way and behind them, those that would erase your existence, your Saga, from the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

No theatrical event can be had without its cast and audience.  That's you.

If funded, Sagas will have a home and insurance in October for its first Open Beta event, "Incursion", a dramatic recreation of an important historical event within the dying world of Evindale.  Where the story goes from there, like all of Sagas, is entirely up to you: the cast member.

If you fund at the Caffeine Supporter level, you'll get a mighty thanks from us on our website as one of the almighty Gods of Support on our Sagas website, sagaslarp.com

If you fund at any of the Preregistration levels, you will be able to participate as a preregistered member in the October Incursion event.

How you bring Sagas to life

Sagas is designed to be theatrical and immersive, allowing you lose yourself for over 36 hours straight in a fictitious world over the course of a weekend.  To make it so fully immersive, If funded, Sagas will use this meager funding to:
  • Run the October event!
  • Rent a venue
  • Purchase liability insurance
  • Get much needed office materials such as printer paper, toner, and envelopes for character sheets and rules packets; small props such as the game's currency, "Fragments"; and minimal makeup for Dedicated Cast characters.
Once we reach our goal, you can help us reach our stretch goals to create an even livelier and immersive environment.  This includes:
  • Storage unit -- In order for Sagas to grow, we want to make a permanent home, and that means building a much needed storage unit so we can grow and expand your game.
  • Better costuming for incidental Directed Cast (NPCs) which means a more believable  atmosphere
  • Better props -- Sagas doesn't use Item Tags for all things.  Being immersive, we wish to provide you with actual items, not just flimsy pieces of paper that are supposed to represent some potent magical item
  • Special effects -- Fog, smoke, lights, LEDs, specially crafted monster costumes, spectacular props, and more to enhance your experience.

Risks & Challenges

There's no risk to you if we're not funded for this event.  To ensure our goals are realistic, we've identified those needs we know for a fact we can meet.

  • The rules system has been modified based on player suggestions from our May 2015 play test event, and from meetings held nearly every month since.  We listen.
  • Artwork in printed and web material is always needed.  Fortunately, Raven's Head Productions, LLC engages in other events that yielded artistic contacts.  Already, we've engaged their high-quality business for some of the tribe logos and plan to continue.
  • TribalPunk is a new genre of setting, an apocalyptic atmosphere amongst a tribal people.  Its art style has yet to be truly defined thereby risking the creation of an amalgamation of costuming until we get it "right".  Do we know what it looks like when we see it?  Yes, but this is not good enough.  Direction must be had and to make up for our costuming shortcomings we've started seeking costume designers to help us identify and create the tribal appearance of the people of Sta'abri within the world of Evindale.
  • If you contribute but then can't make it, we will gladly apply any bonus and purchased Service Point rewards to your character so it may be spent on your character the next time you attend, in addition to any purchased SP from that attended game.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sagas is more than money.  You will be part of a growing community of enthusiasts who may wish to contribute in other ways.  From crafting props to joining our storytelling team, we can always use the help in some fashion.

Know someone who might be interested in joining Sagas?  Point them to our website, sagaslarp.com.  Better yet, bring them to a game as a first time player and we'll reward you with 200 Service Points (in addition to the 20 SP for playing this event!).

Thank you SO much for helping us bring you a fantastic experience in the near future.

story:
TRUMP’ED is a table top RPG card game of the presidential candidate's most famous quotes.

 “I will build a great wall — and nobody builds walls better than me, believe me — and I’ll build them very inexpensively. I will build a great, great wall on our southern border, and I will make Mexico pay for that wall. Mark my words.”

Donald J. Trump

16th June 2015 Presidential Announcement. 

 Source

 

Trump’ed is a table top RPG card game of the presidential candidate‘s most famous quotes. Reflect on all of Mr. Trump's best quotes in one neat collection of cards and battle with your friends to find Trump’s top quote.

Play with your friends and joke about Trump and other “enlightened” minds.

Ban All Muslims card

TRUMP'ED consists of 36 quotes, and counting, taken from throughout Trump's career and his recent presidential campaign as well as other historical leaders including Hitler, Saddam and more... 

The quotes are scored for Ego, Racism, Sexism, Anti-Democratic Factor, Number of Followers and Net Worth, culminating in a final computed Dictator score.

Here's how it works 

Each quote is rated on a scale of 1 - 10 (Low - High) for Ego, Racism, Sexism and Anti-Democracy. Scores are currently being crowd sourced and the final scores will be determined at the end of this campaign. If you would like to contribute to scoring the quotes you will be able to on our website shortly.

The number of followers is an estimate based on publicly available information and is calculated as the sum of Trumps book sales, Apprentice TV viewing figures, Twitter followers and the proportion of the Republican Party nomination at the time of the quote. We have used a equivalent method for quotes where the above are not relevant (i.e., for historical characters). 

Trump's estimated net worth is derived from an average of valuations provide by Forbes magazine rich list and Trump's own public declarations of wealth.

The Dictator Score is a dynamic score calculated as follows: (Ego + Racism + Sexism + Anti-democratic factor) X (# Followers (Millions) + Net Worth (Billions) = Dictator Score 

All quotes have been checked by our team to ensure accuracy and references will be provided on our website soon. We are always happy hear about new, or old, quotes of a similar nature.

How to play 

TRUMP'ED is a game for 2 - 6 players and the rules are simple. The object of the game is to be crowned Trump by winning all the cards.

  • Deal equal cards face down to each player
  • Player to the left of the dealer starts by turning over the top card and reading the quote in their best Trump fashion
  • The player then chooses a trait and reads out the value to the other players 
  • The other players then turn over the top card 
  •  The player with the highest value wins all the cards for that round 
  • If there is a draw, the cards go into the center and the players who drew battle again, using new cards and the same trait
  • The player who won the previous round starts the next round 
  • When you run out of cards you have been TRUMP'ED 

Warning: playing under the effects of alcohol may lead to uncontrolled bouts of aggression, high blood pressure, nausea, vomiting and in extreme cases death. Please leave your guns outside.

Where we're at

Card Design 

The card designs are complete, although minor alterations may occur between now and the release date depending on feedback. Prototypes have been printed to check for quality. Where possible we want to use public domain or Creative Commons images under BY-SA 2.0 licences. Some images, which improve the design and look of the game, are copyright protected. We will attain all relevant copyrights for any images used and make all required attributions before publication of any images.

The concept for the packaging has been created. The designs are in progress. We will keep you updated. You can follow us on Facebook or Twitter for updates and designs. 

T-Shirts and Baseball Cap Designs 

To begin with T-shirts will be available in blue only, for both men and women, with sizes ranging from S - XXL and two design options:

  • Logo and tag line on the front 
  • Logo on the front, tag line on the back 

T-shirts will be American Apparel, 100% Cotton and Made in the USA.

The exact logo designs are still being decided. We will update you when we know more.

Baseball Caps

Baseball caps will initially only be available in blue with white stitching and red trim with the logo on the front. As with all the great presidential candidates our baseball caps will be made in the USA by Unionwear. The exact design of the baseball caps are still to be decided. 

Our primary product is the TRUMP'ED game. However, in light of this year's presidential nomination we decided to commemorate the occasion with t-shirts, caps, and more.

If our campaign is successful we will bring out a range of t-shirts and caps in the red, white and blue with multiple designs. 

Website

The website is currently is development. It should be ready very soon. We will keep you posted on developments.

What's next 

We are in a bit of a conundrum at Hypocrite Games; if Trump goes all the way to the White House we continue to get new content leading to extend editions and expansion packs, maybe another 4 years worth; can you imagine!

We at Hypocrite Games are putting measures into place to ensure this doesn't happen with the paradoxical publication of TRUMP'ED the game.

If all goes well we intend to release different games, both physical and virtual, with a mobile version of TRUMP'ED already under conceptualization . Another time and another campaign. 

What's the money for

The money raised will go to covering the costs for, product supply and fulfillment, TRUMP'ED trademark registration in USA, EU and Canada, further design on the website and products, social media marketing, obtain copyright for images, business insurance and legal fees.

Risks and Challenges

At present, we have suitable images for each quote. However, there is a risk the copyright owner may refuse a licence. In this instance a suitable replacement will be found. We have chosen not to display these images at present for obvious reasons. If any one has suitable images they would allow to be used please send them to hello@trumped.cards.

There is also inherent risk from Mr Trump himself. Hypocrite Games LLC has been set up solely to complete the fulfillment within the US, EU and Canada. Mr Trump is well known to protect his "$3 Billion" brand, regularly suing potential threats . Our marketing makes it clear that we are in no way associated with Mr Trump, and our product will be legally produced under the ______ law. Our team has made every attempt to ensure the quotes are accurate and the information has not been trumped-up. 

The scoring is crowd sourced, calculated from public information and or computed; mitigating any risk of defamation. However, in light of the publicity such an event would bring we are not sure if this is a risk or an advantage.

Risk are also associated with the name TRUMP'ED and obtaining and defending the registered trademark. Conflicts arise with the old British card game Top Trumps®, with whom we have no affiliation, and other TRUMP related trademarks. After an initial search of the USPTO Trademark database we are confident on obtaining the trademark. Registrations will be filed shortly.

We do have suppliers and distributors ready in the USA and EU. Issues may arise in the future depending on the supply chain, demand and logistics.

The Impact

TRUMP'ED is concerned a 2nd edition may be in the pipeline. In order to repair the damage a second edition may have on society. Hypocrite Games has committed to donating 5% of the revenues from the 1st edition of TRUMP'ED to charitable causes. That works out at $0.50 for every $10 raised. We estimate this calculates to 25% of gross profit. We prefer to give this charitable donation from revenues to ensure profits can not be downgraded and the charities get zero. We wish to, and may still give, a larger proportion to charity however we would like to have some funds in reserve in case we come into difficulties downstream.

In a world of continued separation and inequality, politics needs to focus on building bridges and not creating walls. In order to assist with building bridges and helping displaced peoples suffering the consequence of "great" walls; our chosen charities for donations are UNHCR - The UN Refugee Agency and Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF / Doctors Without Boarders). Donations will be divided equally between the 2 charities. If you have recommendation of suitable charities please send them so hello@trumped.crads with the title charity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but still like the idea please share on social media and with your friends. Alternatively you can make direct donations through PayPal and Bitcoin on our website www.trumped.cards.

You can also contribute to the scoring of the cards, submit new or previously unidentified quotes and more on our website. Feel free to submit quotes of a similar rhetoric either from Trump or other world leaders. When submitting a quote you will be required to provide a source, date and reason why it is suitable for entry.

story:
Story and universe

Many years have passed since humanity first left the surface of its mother planet Earth and decided to explore the sky. And did not stop there. Driven by the overpopulation of the planet and the desire for knowledge, for centuries of failure it has became possible to uncover the secrets of space travel.

New worlds, new resources have been discovered. And it is in human nature to fight for these. Whole empires were created and subsequently disappeared, pushed out by neighbors, or destroyed from within. In addition, rumors of an aggressive, extraterrestrial race that invaded the peripheral worlds have appeared. When these rumors turned into a real manace and threat to the human race as whole, most of the quarrelled factions began to talk about an alliance, although temporary.

This is how the Confederacy arose, which is present to this day. Quantas of newly emerging confederation currency began to flow into common funds. In addition to building a common infrastructure, a vast logistics and defensive positions around the core of the sector, a considerable amount of money was spent to finance the new Keepers project.

The Keepers program trains the most talented pilots in the sector and transforms them into elite unit members. These pilots do not specialize in only one type of spacecraft, because of their training and talent, they control all available classes. They are experts in both weapons and defense systems, engineering and they are strategy expets who master the maneuvering of the ship. The graduates of this program is referred to as the Keepers and are widely deployed on battlefields as a strategic advisor and moral boost. In similar rate in secret and sabotage operations (black ops).

Not much is known about the program. The information is intentionally concealed to the public and deliberately misrepresented. Rumors say that immoral practices such as cybernetic and genetic experiments on cadets are also covered. Apparently to get the best out of the subjects. Which allegedly leads to frequent departures and, more often, cadets' deaths. The program only completes the strongest. However, it seems to fulfill its purpose ...

 

The game

As outlined above, this is a multiplayer space game where the player is a pilot. He flies a spaceship and tries to shoot down other players or fight the environment (PvE and PvP).

AFK´s destination platform is PC, for now.

The main element of the game is dynamics. Everything starts with selecting a game type (* Chapters: "What to expect in the future", "Game modes") and then selecting a map. Each map is more or less generated by a pseudo-random. E.g. asteroid clusters of different sizes and speeds are created as well as their predefined count. This ensures a more dynamics to the game, as there are no specialized places where players can use the environment (such as camping) to their unfair advantage. This also makes every map unique.

Players join the host and select the type/class of spaceship. Each is specific in something - is better in a particular area, and disadvantaged in another. These areas include speed, health of ship, number of slots in inventory, initial weapons, ability or inability to use some of the found powerups. After selecting a ship the game / round (depending on the type) begins.

Singleplayer

Main focus will be Multiplayer but not everyone wants to or cannot play with others. So we will add a singleplayer option. Player will choose a similar map and mode like it is in MP and play againts AI bots.

There will be also tutorial how to play the game.

We have prepared a short story, how the Keepers are trained and few scenario maps. We dont promise this will be implemented to game but we would implement a short campaign if there will be demand for it.

Ships and their properties

Each ship has same features but differently strong. These abilities can be temporarily improved or, on the contrary, worsen, whether by you or enemy.

Health (HitPoints or HP) - is divided into 3 categories, subsystems. The exterior surface is shielded by an energy shield that, in the case of damage to most ships, is recovered per time unit. The middle layer of defence is armor / plating. The inner layer is the hull of the ship. Once this is destroyed, the ship is destroyed and the player died. Depending on the type of game, the player is respawned instantly or at the end of round.

Speed ​​and Dexterity - The ship always flies forward at minimum speed (or stands still in specific scenario). Speed can be increased to maximum and is specific to each ship class. As well as dexterity and control of the ship - the speed of turning and tilt. We know that avionics is contrary to space physics. But no one wants Star Wars fighters with perpendicular maneuvers.

Weapon - is primary attack of ship and each has its ammunition (type of). The capacity of the weapon in terms of ammunition is limited, ie it can only be filled to a certain amount. The weapons have a charging and discharging part, and each fired "projectile" has a defined interval from the other one (firerate). Ammunition can be specialized, such as EMP rounds more easily damage shields of the enemy ship, but then cause less damage to the hull and armor.

Slots and inventory - is limited, mostly, by a ship size. Each slot represents the installed weapon or module. This entire grouping of slots is named inventory. You can switch between slots ie between modules so ship can carry multiple systems at  once.

Items - will appear on the map in random configurations and positions, again controlled by pseudorandom. These are disposable items (one-use) or permanent modules. Disposable items serve as a temporary boost, such as replenishing shields or repairing a ship or increasing weapon damage ("healing potion" type). The modules are installed in the slot until the player respawns or toss it. These modules can be passive or active. For example, the passive one can increase the speed of a ship or reduce damage. The active ones are used as weapons and often have a long cooldown. The weapons themselves are active modules.


Game Modes (Game Types)

Deathmatch - is a classic free-for-all. Fast and very dynamic. Playing in this mode may be limited in play time (round duration) or to the count of kills (frags) of other pilots.

Team-Deathmatch - Like Deathmatch with 2 or more teams with the ability to turn on auto-balancing of teams. It may require a bit of tactical thinking, but it can be chaotic shootout anyway.

Capture the flag - or game of stealing flags. The goal is to get an enemy flag (item) and deliver it to a particular place. Limited by time or number of successfully delivered flags.

Guardian - One team attacks and the other defends a certain place. Once completed, the role is switched. Limited to reach goal (in-time or not). Necessary tactical thinking of the attackers.

Role-play mission - PvE mode where 3 or more players join together (according to map and scenario). They then aim to perform certain tasks and reach the end of the map. Unlike other modes, players do not respawn automatically. You need to work together. Losing one player can mean the entire mission has failed.

 

Background, inspiration and our team

We are indie developers from the Czech Republic. Our team has only 2 people, a programmer and a graphic designer. We are professional freelancers and you guess right, a programmer and a grafic designer. We're a (dating) couple who LOVE to play video games and our dream is to release our first game.

We are just two ordinary people, with passion for videogames and dream to make our own.

I, Petr, the programmer, am responsible for game design and all programming, partialy for some design in technical terms (post-processing f.e.).

Petra (funny, right?), graphic designer, takes care of everything else. Visual effect, audio, modeling, textures, all presentation stuff like teaser video...

As the great Star Wars fans and scifi in general, we have always been fascinated by a universe and space ships. Space fights have always been and will be a feast for the eye, whether in view of cockpit, bridge or tactical map (or hi-tech holographic projection). We love universe and near future documentaries as well as books, movies and games.

Lets divide the game and inspiration to 2 parts.

We were very inspired by EVE online, which has added a lot of functionality especially in recent years and has solved some burning questions about the purchased time. There are titles such as Homeworld, Sins of and Solar Empire, Mass Effect and others that only deepened our interest and inspiration with their detailed spacecrafts.

Last but not least, there is the second part of the inspiration that heavily influenced the style of the game. This part was born in the deep 90's, when it started out as an avalanche, spreading FPS multiplayer games and LAN gaming was more affordable than ever. We were always absorbed by x-hour gaming and friendly matches in Quake 2 (Edge map forever) or Half-life, which never ended with rage-quit or broken friendship. At that time, games were played for fun, killing time with friends, nobody proving anything to anyone with immature gestures ...

Games have been great entertaiment since the early years (pre-elementary) and we always wanted to create one of our own. Or just take one and make it our way. Back then a lots of games came out with map editors, a great tool to make your own scenarios. With a lot of time that a teenager has, it was then possible, for example, to make our own campaign in Starcraft. Well in truth... we took a bit of a non-standard approach (parody) when the main protagonist was named Jack Potato (Jack Brambor in Czech) and he helped to save Marleies civilization (named after Bob Marley). A lot of time was spent on dubbing and the whole process was strenuous and fun at the same time. Unfortunatelly I had a defective HDD and after few missions I have lost everything includes my old work...

This did not stop us. Doing games has become a dream and to some extent obsession ...

With maturity, and with a preview of the programming and gamedesign in general, the dream seems to began far more real. Even after the first attempts and mistakes with the creation of code and graphics (QBasic, Macromedia Flash - at elementary), together with the professional life experience (programming and graphic design of application), even more. Then it came to a stage where we were working on games more than working on job tasks ... Logically, there had to be a turn-point and since then it was no longer possible to work like that. And so it happened that we were unable to work on games anymore. The last AFK update is from November 2018.

Time to time we were talking about our homemade creations and colleges, clients, family and friend took interest. They reviewed the state of AFK and have pushing us forward to finish it since then. But we always replied, that we dont have time capacities...

Crowdfounding could solve this situation and that's why we are here and you are reading this long article.

Where your money will go

Most of the game mechanics are done but it lacks content. We primarily want to pay a "modest living" so we can mainly focus on development instead of contracts (freelance jobs).

Furthermore, it will be necessary to purchase licenses and some artistic creations such as better (paid) sounds and textures (graphics in general) which we are unable to reproduce.

With the required amount, we will be able to release the game as a "full game" or more likely as Early-Access (a game fund during development) in about 2-3 months of intense work. Of course we would like to continue working on it even after. Adding more and more content.

Ideal scenario: make the basic game, place it on steam with early-access, continue on it up to year (year and half if we implement all the stuff we have in our minds). Early access price will be 8-12 USD, something like that. Full-game? We are not sure, maybe a little bit more (up to 15 USD), but we think it will pretty much the same as early access. There are lots of variables.

What now and what next scenario

We have a lot of ideas in our minds, but from previous experiences we are already "grounded" and we soberly think of every move - instead of impulsive realization.

The game is estimated to be about 80% complete - in terms of skeletal elements. We need to complete this and add a new content in the form of new ships, items, maps and game modes ... We want to improve graphics and effects. Now we have only 1 ship and 1 map.

We are counting on the eternal balancing of the game - ship and weapons.

Basically, the first early-access game should contain 3 playable maps, 3 types of ships, 6 weapons and 5-10 items. Only one game mode will be Deathmatch. This will be a good the starting point. Further progress and roadmap will be published on instagram f.e.

Further plans are dependent on interest and resources. We want to implement other game modes (especially role-play is the most challenging and at the same time the most appealing), the other ingame-content - constantly expanding the game to final form.

As was mentioned before, target platform is PC. We love to extend it on Linux, Mac and Xbox. At the point we cannot promise that.

We also want to pay for the development of a website where we create a community and a background for communication of players with a team of developers (bug reports, etc.)

Over time, we want to implement a third-party server solution so players can play "online" completely. Search for or host your own. But this is a very difficult task. And it is "echoes of future".

Long term goal is to raise enough resources to make other games then. Pay artitst, other developers,... Create a studio maybe? Do it full time. That is why we need your help.

Playable DEMO?

Now the game is not in state we can give you to try it. There are few serious bugs which are still not taken care of.

But we like this idea and we will give you (free, you do not have to contribute) access to demo version later - approx. in middle of the May 2019.

Risks & challenges

At first, creating a game is complex process. It tooks lots of time, effort, talent, experience and knowledge. As any software development, to be honest. It is a continous learning process and sometimes there is better way how make it work properly in cost of additional needed time.

These and others (like optimistic release time) can make release date(s) shifted. Nobody likes that inclueded us. But well, it happens.

Our team is created by 2 people, which do everything from firing a bullet, collision with asteroid, textures, models, to creating scene effects and level design... We are not AAA company with name on market and HUGE budget...

Problem in these days are projects which have overhyped campaign and the results are poor (instead of pure). One thing is clear. The communication, lies, false promises and technical issues are the core of problem which cause players to leave or distrust any game development in future. We fully understand that. As we also bought early access games with great potential, which are almost unplayable but this time - "Early-access disaster".

Lets take a look to our plans how to conquer these.

At first, let us make one thing clear. When we say we do not lie to you - it is shorter version of: "We are not stupid/brave enough to take responsibility for every lie we could say/write/publish. Every lie has an eventual aftermath which can destroy our dream very quickly. We understand that someone can be offended with truth/reality but we choose to stay honest and give you the option to deal with given information your way."

Communication

We dont lie to you. Finishing game in-time is a challenge as described before. But when problem is discovered, we will let you know. Problem makes you mad anyway, why not try to calm you down instead of playing a dead bug. This is why we dont give you DEMO right now.

Hopefully we raise enough to create website and build community services to communicate with you effectively.

Lies

We dont lie to you. Everything written here is truth and it is about you, if you trust us and want to help us. As we mentioned before, we do not want to take any risk from any lie to danger game development. Releasing the game is our dream. We want to play it too!

Making game is expensive and required amount (we assure you) is not enought to live on Bahamas with a released Vaporware... It barely pays the time we already spent on it. But for us, it is a starting point to finish it to (publicly) playable form and give it needed care. And content of course.

False promises

We dont lie to you. We are not experts with tenths of thousands of years of experience in making games or its content. It is officially our first game after all. But we are experienced enough from professional life to make it done and please you with result. At the end the results count only and you will be the judge. Google "variablearts" and you will see our work.

We dont want any microtransaction nor DLCs nor monthly subscription!

Technical issues

We dont lie to you. We are currently using public game engine which seems to "do the job". But in recent time there were compatibility issues in newly released versions. This concernes us deeply at the same level as we already know the GAME (previously mentioned as early-access disaster) which is using the same engine is totally not optimized and has multiplayer issues. FPS drop rates, bugs (i mean serious which closes the game completely), lags and issues in client server sync... All these and others make us disbelieve it is not only issue of a irresponsibility of company creating the game but the engine itself.

This may cause the portation to another publicly available engine or even writing our own (in extreme case). We dont want to release low quality game.

That is it

If you read all of these, you have our respect. We believe we wrote everything that you need to know if you want to help us with your contribute.

You can do even more. and help us in other way. Share this in social media, give a word to a friends or colleges, folks interested in projects like this. This will do great.

Every contributor will have a opportunity to change the game. Follow us on instagram: https://www.instagram.com/astrofight/

We will weekly let you know about our progress. We will show you new content and things we are working on as well as decisions. Time to time we will public behind scene information. When the game will be released as first early-access, contributors could enter special area where will be private information only for them. We appreciate every contributor and as gesture of proving it we will let you, contributors, vote for game content! For example we will give you a list of possibilities and you choose which will be implemented first, which later, and which absolutely not.

Dont forget to use indiegogo tools.

We have perks which we hope you will find attractive. Do you have idea for a perk or we missing something? Let us know.

We will dress you and give you a fuel tank f.e.

We thank you very much for reading this article and your support! I hope my english skills are good enough.
story_txt:
Story and universe
Many years have passed since humanity first left the surface of its mother planet Earth and decided to explore the sky. And did not stop there. Driven by the overpopulation of the planet and the desire for knowledge, for centuries of failure it has became possible to uncover the secrets of space travel.
New worlds, new resources have been discovered. And it is in human nature to fight for these. Whole empires were created and subsequently disappeared, pushed out by neighbors, or destroyed from within. In addition, rumors of an aggressive, extraterrestrial race that invaded the peripheral worlds have appeared. When these rumors turned into a real manace and threat to the human race as whole, most of the quarrelled factions began to talk about an alliance, although temporary.
This is how the Confederacy arose, which is present to this day. Quantas of newly emerging confederation currency began to flow into common funds. In addition to building a common infrastructure, a vast logistics and defensive positions around the core of the sector, a considerable amount of money was spent to finance the new Keepers project.

The Keepers program trains the most talented pilots in the sector and transforms them into elite unit members. These pilots do not specialize in only one type of spacecraft, because of their training and talent, they control all available classes. They are experts in both weapons and defense systems, engineering and they are strategy expets who master the maneuvering of the ship. The graduates of this program is referred to as the Keepers and are widely deployed on battlefields as a strategic advisor and moral boost. In similar rate in secret and sabotage operations (black ops).
Not much is known about the program. The information is intentionally concealed to the public and deliberately misrepresented. Rumors say that immoral practices such as cybernetic and genetic experiments on cadets are also covered. Apparently to get the best out of the subjects. Which allegedly leads to frequent departures and, more often, cadets' deaths. The program only completes the strongest. However, it seems to fulfill its purpose ...
 
The game
As outlined above, this is a multiplayer space game where the player is a pilot. He flies a spaceship and tries to shoot down other players or fight the environment (PvE and PvP).
AFK´s destination platform is PC, for now.

We appreciate every contributor and as gesture of proving it we will let you, contributors, vote for game content! For example we will give you a list of possibilities and you choose which will be implemented first, which later, and which absolutely not.
Dont forget to use indiegogo tools.
We have perks which we hope you will find attractive. Do you have idea for a perk or we missing something? Let us know.

We will dress you and give you a fuel tank f.e.

We thank you very much for reading this article and your support! I hope my english skills are good enough.

story:
Shield Shock is a 2D Fighter Platformer Game all about blocking! Use your shield to block enemy projectiles and release mighty attacks right back!

          We hope to develop a 4 Player Party Fighting Game based around the mechanic of defense, offering various types of characters, stages, items and modes! The more money we raise, the better game we can create!

         

 

 

Supporter Pack Fighter   (Kite Shield & Above Reward)

 

 

 

  1. $500 - Game is Released and Published on Steam
  2. $1000 - 4 Player Story Mode!
  3. $2000 - Console Release: Possible Consoles: (PS4, SWITCH, XBOX 1)

Every $300 raised after the Main Goal towards our game we will develop more content including: New Stages, New Characters, New Modes).

  • $800 - New Character + New Stage + New Item
  • $1100 - New Mode + New Character + New Stage + New Item
  • $1400 - (2) New Characters + (2) New Stages + (3) New Items
  • $1700 - New Mode + (2) New Characters + (2) New Stages + (3) New Items
  • $2000 - POSSIBLE ONLINE PLAY!


 

 

 See How The Game Was Created! (Youtube Devlog Series) 

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jVj7ZrLjlSM&amp... 

 

 Check Out Our Twitter For More Information 

https://twitter.com/Dev_Boundless

 

 

Risks and challenges

Risks that may come up would be final approval with other console platforms, such as PS4, SWITCH, and XBOX 1 confirmation.
