story:
Summary

First of all, thank you for taking the time to view my project!

I am a lone Indie developer currently working on a revolutionary horror game called 'Resonance' in which you use echolocation (sonar) to navigate through a terrifying narrative experience. 

In Resonance you awake in an unknown environment. Don't let the Cliche beginning fool you - the original and complex narrative of the game unfolds naturally as you play. Although you begin the game clueless to your environment, a player with a keen eye will soon put together the pieces of the puzzle and find themselves answering the questions posed from the very beginning. Solving the mystery of the backstory and environment is the key to success in this multi-ended game.

Current features:​​

  • Echolocation - In Resonance you are able to see by making noise. This can be through movement, clapping, interacting with the environment and other methods. However, when you make noise you risk being discovered by things you would rather avoid. This adds an interesting element of strategy to navigating the environment which is enhanced by thoughtful and innovative level design and multiple enemy types each with different ways to detect you.
  • Every death is a serious loss. Like old-school games if you die too often and lose all “lives” then it is game over. This is a very important feature for a horror game which is often overlooked. The primary flaw of otherwise excellent games like Resident Evil 7 and Outlast is that after a few deaths you will begin to feel immune to the element of fear. Each death reminds you that there is no real danger or reason for suspense as there is nothing at stake. This is not the case in Resonance - die too many times and you will lose your progress. (This feature can be disabled if it is not to your liking).
  • The game is near content-completion and will be released on Steam Early Access to further expand the game through extending the narrative and adding new mechanics. Models, textures and animations are already at a production-level of quality.
  • The personal ideas of all backers and Early Access purchasers will directly affect the final game - I want to listen to my audience and turn this 1-person Dev team into thousands of vocal community members giving their input to make this game a perfect experience.

Who am I?

My name is Andrew Nicolaou, I consider myself a Jack of all trades - currently adept in all elements of game design such as programming, 3D-modelling, animating, story-telling and level-design. Having a computer science background and a long-lasting passion for videogames and creative works is what drove me to begin this project. Early this year, having already mastered the Unity3D engine and Blender 3D-modelling software through developing small personal projects, I decided I was ready to embark on this commercial endeavor and began full-time development of my first published game. Now, five months down the line, I could use some help from you to finish it. 

               

                                            Help me (and my cat) bring this game to market!

What We Need & What You Get

This is where YOU come in. By helping raise the funds necessary you will be ensuring the future of this game. You can help far more than you think by pledging even a small amount.

Sound Effects:

  • Sound is integral to the very premise of this game so sound effects must be developed in-house and be extremely high quality.
  • I am currently working with a professional sound effects artist and sound engineer to make this possible.
  • Currently the sound track contains 4 songs which will be expanded greatly.

Exposure:

  • Making a great game is no longer enough for it to be noticed by its audience.
  • Unfortunately the Indie scene is extremely over-saturated in today's market with low quality games flooding Steam and other platforms making it nearly impossible for a good indie game to be noticed.
  • Trying to self publish a game is often impossible without significant funds.
  • Yet choosing to partner with a publisher means perverting the artistic image of the game in order to drive profits through corporate greed.
  • I don't want to be forced to put micro-transactions in this single player game!
  • To gain any exposure a modest marketing budget must be considered to be used for intelligent marketing using medium-profile Youtubers and Websites.

Continued Development:

  • I’ve already sunk a large amount of my personal money into the project and am now finding it difficult to cover living expenses while also investing in the game. In order to stay independent and avoid the external influences of publishers I am opting to independently develop this game. 
  • Put simply, I gotta eat!

How the money will be spent

If fully funded the breakdown will be a little like this:

  • £2000 - Professional sound track and sfx development.
  • £2000 - Intelligent marketing using medium-profile Youtubers and Websites.
  • £1000 - Continued development up until Early Access Release.

Unique Perks

  • Pledge anything and your name will be included in the ThankYou.txt file packaged with the game.
  • Pledge £5 to receive the Early Adopters price for a copy of the game as well as the opportunity to have your input affect the development of the game.
  • Pledge £10 to receive the game as well as the final sound track and digital concept artwork (some of these are literal ball-point pen scribbles).
  • Pledge £100  to be credited as a vital investor in the game.
  • Pledge £500 to have an NPC named after you (the name may be altered slightly to fit the lore of the game).
  • Pledge £1000 to design a short sequence in the game (e.g a puzzle and enemy sequence).

Stretch Goals

  • £6000 – Steam trading card system
  • £10000 – release on Android and IOS
  • £20000 – VR support

What if the goal is not met?

Funds will be divided in a similar way however a greater emphasis will be put on the sound effects as they are the primary requirement before finishing the game.

The final release date may also be affected if full funding is not reached however this game is definitely going to be released - I've come too far to stop working on it now.

The Impact

Funding this game sends the world a message that Indie Developers can stand out and that publishers are not needed to be successful. One small step at a time we can help revitalize the videogame industry, essentially it's just good karma.

On top of that you will have a personal effect on the development of this game and get to enjoy this fully fleshed-out unique horror experience.

Risks & Challenges

This game will be released regardless of funding or hurdles in the future. The quality of the game is subject to correct alpha-testing practices which I am still learning. This will not hold me back. I have years of experience in games development, 3D modelling, animating and programming. If this project has taught me anything it is that there is not a skill on this earth that I can't learn with 7 days of hard work and an internet connection. 

Potential delays in the final build of the game are always an issue. To help alleviate the impact of this to backers I will be committed to frequent early access updates and full transparency. Any delays will be necessary to ensure that the final version of this game is as perfect as possible while I aim to balance scope with budget and time. I am well-versed in agile development practices and hope to continue incorporating these in development to deliver the best game possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow @ResonantGameDev on Twitter or and share as much of our content as you can! 

Spread the word - talk to your friends, share on social media, do whatever you can to get this campaign and the game noticed!

Feel free to contact me directly at: resonantgamestudios@gmail.com I'd love to hear your feedback and personally answer any questions you might have.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Game about heroic adventures of the brave cats, beautiful cat-princesses, legends and dragondogs. Meowville Acatemy of Heroes, that has protected the realm for thousandsof years, has met its new enemy. Soon the graduates from the Acatemy are going to see that the powers that they are fighting are not that simple. While they are on their quest to victory, characters can create a family, train new heroes, leave their own mark in history to become those legendary heroes in bard’s songs.

 

Open World & Random encounters

The game has simple travelling via world map. You can create your own path. On your way, you will stumble upon random encounters e.g. Monsters, Friendly NPCs or events inside your own party.

Time cycle

Time is turn-based, any action that you do will affect the time. The "bigger" the action is, the longer it will take. Day is visually divided into morning, noon, evening and night.

  

     

    Meowville Town

    The starting location for most of the Cat’s adventures. There you can get some quests, trade, learn new skills in Acatemy, buy your own property and spend some time with your wife/husband and children.

    Biomes

    Purr-Purr Forest

    Located nearby Meowville. Includes some small villages and sawmill. Unwary traveler can stumble upon groups of wolves and bandits.

    Darkforest

    The cemetery of the fallen heroes is situated here. In the midsts of the forest necromancers are practicing their dark arts, causing zombies and ghosts to wander around.

    Badlands

    Harsh lands inhabited by dangerous monsters and cats with a bad reputation.The Black Market is the only large and relatively secure settlement in this area.

    Caves

    Caves of the Yak-Yak -mountain are hiding lots of secrets, treasures, deadly traps and scary monsters. Many brave cats have fallen there.

    Plain

    In these lands you can see a few small villages and The Bureau of Missing Princesses for those who want to find their true love.

    Mysterious Ruins

    Ruins left by unknown civilization. A place full of mysteries and dangers, that you will explore.

    Villages

    Various small villages that your Cat will meet on its way. There you can spend your money, take quests and meet some unique NPCs.

     

    The game has the turn-based combat system and it is a party based RPG. You can hire up to 3 companions in the Hero Acatemy. Party of 4 cats controlled by you, each one with its own inventory and skill tree.

    Enemies & Monsters

    In the vast world of Untold Cat Stories player can meet different animals:

    • Unfriendly cats
    • Wolves
    • Bears
    • Spiders
    • Scorpions
    • Zombies
    • Ghosts
    • Dragondogs
      and many others.

    Turn-based combat system

     

    Upgradable armor & weapon

    Armor and weapons are upgradable by using specific items.

      Tools

      You can create items to gather resources.

      Gems

      Precious gems can infuse items with their power. They can be combined with both weapons and armor. The bigger the gem, the more powerful effect it will have.

       

      Growing up

      Your character will start out young and it will get older as you go through the game. Cat’s age affects the stats.

      Personal home

      A character will be able to buy a house. If you have a couple, their preferences will change the reaction when they see the house.
      Quality of the building and the amount of rooms directly affects the maximum family size.
      All of your trophies are stored in the house and provide passive buffs. You can also use your house as a storage.
      Different types of houses require different amounts of resources.

      Marriage

      Each Cat-princess has its own “taste”. You will have to make sure that she likes you in order to get married. Later on, a couple can have children. However, remember to still take care of the marriage after all of that.

      Kittens

      If you decide to have kids, be ready to teach and raise them. In case of divorce, child can only stay with one parent. Once it comes of age, it can either become a companion or an independent character.
      Mother is better at raising girls, father - boys. If you forget about that your child will not grow to their full potential.

      Divorce

      Having troubles in the relationship? Maybe, you found someone better? At any time, you can apply for divorce. Be careful with cheating, if you get caught it will most likely end up in divorce. All the property will be sold, the money split equally.
      If you had kids, they will stay with either one of parents. If its not you, you will have to pay alimony.

      Pension

      Your character can retire, ending it’s adventurer career. If you have a son or a daughter, they can take some of your items in order to become the new main character.
      You character can also become a mentor in the Acatemy.

      Cemetery

      All the heroes and companions will be buried in the cemetery. If you are a Necromancer, you can bring them back temporarily.

       

       

       

      Valentin Bezchasnuyk
      Director; Manager; Programmer;

       

      Alexander Cirno
      Game Designer; Main Artist; Animator;

       

      Elisey Kuzyakin
      Composer; Sound Designer; Designer;

       

      Anastasia Prokofieva
      Scriptwriter;

       

      Nikita Petrov
      Translator;

       

      Anna Snyadovskaya
      Background Artist;

      Project will be finished no matter what. Any support, if it is financial or just spreading the information about the game to friends or in social media, will speed up the process. If we see that a certain mechanics is not working the way it was intended, we have the right to remove it.

       

      • Food for us and our kitties;
      • Bills (taxes and rentfor our existence);
      • Engine licenses;
      • If the donations reach a certain amount, game will be translated to 3 more languages chosen by voting on the website;
        Basic languages: english, russian;
      • Extra expenses (e.g. sound packs, assets, etc.)

       

      Email: post@ev-hr.com
      Our site: ev-hr.com
      Facebook: fb.com/evhorizon
      Twitter: twitter.com/ev_hr_gm
      VK: vk.com/ev_hr

       

      The game will be released on 
      Windows, Linux and Mac.

story:
> WHO

The project is led by:

  • Admiral Rafal Wydra, creator of UniverseV lore and game rules
  • Commander Cyryl "Edwarf" Matuszewski, brilliant AI navigator and shader magician
  • Captain Maciej Maczuga, multiplayer mastermind and shipyard constructor

We are passionate gamers with huge experience in game development. You can find us in the credits of many AAA titles. Just search us on mobygames.com if you wish.

 

> WHAT

UniverseV core gameplay is build around three screens: Shipyard, Galaxy and Battle Arena.

In shipyard player can build their own ships from modules discovered during the galactic voyage. Below is the video footage made from in-game view. Yes, it is already playable!

 

The Galaxy view allows player to move his cosmic fleet through the galaxy to his ultimate destination, visiting solar systems along the way. Each Galaxy is generated both for campaign and multiplayer mode.

 

And finally the Battle Arena will be a place to test out new battle tactics with self constructed ships.

Just watch our video to see some basic concepts of space battles that await you. This here is a small sample of what we have prepared so far.

 

> WHERE

You can find us on our official FB fanpage and we are proud to announce that we have been Greenlit on Steam! The game is developed primarily for PC Steam (Windows). But with enough support we can easily extend to other platforms.

 

> HOW

With your help of course! The core gameplay is ready, all parts of the game are prototyped and are now sewn together. But we need devoted artists to generate astonishing ship parts that will comply with ship-part connection rules. Also our UI still needs a lot of polishing. We need to spend hundreds of hours to make compelling AI and balance ship parts' parameters.

Since we are planning to launch on PCs we also need to test the game thoroughly since we know that each rig really differs and we are proud of the quality of all productions that we have worked on.

Based on the funds we can gather we've described several tiers with more content, more functionality and more awesomeness:

  • Basic Campaign mode
  • Common ship module set available for every race
  • Human race specific modules.
  • Full potential of shipbuilding in shipyard
  • Basic multiplayer support for PvP skirmish battles

  • Additional Gollem race with its defense perks and control over space rocks
  • A set of modules specifically designed for Gollem race

  • Additional Appalumis race designed for hit and run fighting style
  • A set of modules specifically designed for Appalumis race

  • Ability to paint your modules with a selection of styles and patterns + a possibility to create custom patterns which will also be visible in PvP battles!
  • Voice chat integration
  • Linux and MacOS version

  • Additional Craspebii race that can exploit solar system instabilities and use opponents attacks against them!
  • A set of modules specifically designed for Craspebii race

  • Additional "Yet unnamed" race with huge damage but slow to operate
  • A set of modules specifically designed for this new race
  • SteamVR support!

If we hit more than $100K we have broad plans for DLCs while console or mobile versions are also a possibility. It all depends on you!

> WHEN

We are targetting to launch at the end of 2017. But as not to keep you waiting, we want to start with early access early next year and also provide an open/closed beta so you too can contribute and balance UniverseV.

 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Cash makes the world go round but you can contribute in many other ways:

  • Spread the word, send this link to your friends and  family
  • Support us on FB and Greenlight
  • Join us in early access and open beta
  • If you are an artist and want to design ship parts or UI do not hesitate a minute longer, CONTACT US!
story_txt:
> WHO
The project is led by:


Admiral Rafal Wydra, creator of UniverseV lore and game rules

Commander Cyryl "Edwarf" Matuszewski, brilliant AI navigator and shader magician

Captain Maciej Maczuga, multiplayer mastermind and shipyard constructor

We are passionate gamers with huge experience in game development. You can find us in the credits of many AAA titles. Just search us on mobygames.com if you wish.
 
> WHAT
UniverseV core gameplay is build around three screens: Shipyard, Galaxy and Battle Arena.
In shipyard player can build their own ships from modules discovered during the galactic voyage. Below is the video footage made from in-game view. Yes, it is already playable!

 
The Galaxy view allows player to move his cosmic fleet through the galaxy to his ultimate destination, visiting solar systems along the way. Each Galaxy is generated both for campaign and multiplayer mode.

 
And finally the Battle Arena will be a place to test out new battle tactics with self constructed ships.

Just watch our video to see some basic concepts of space battles that await you. This here is a small sample of what we have prepared so far.
 

> WHERE

story:
WHO WE ARE

Hi, my name is Paul Andress and I live in the Milwaukee area with my family where I am a lifelong Catholic and a member of Men of Christ, a Catholic Men’s group. My family and I love to spend winter nights playing board games. But we noticed that some games, although fun to play, lacked the moral character that we desired.  So it was only natural that we developed our own game company, DEEPWATER GAMES LLC. The name originated from the quote by St. John Paul the Great, “Do not be afraid. Do not be satisfied with mediocrity. Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch."

The mission of DEEPWATER GAMES  is to bring games to market that are fun and entertaining, but also have a Catholic identity from which the players can learn more about their awesome Catholic faith. We will be developing games that deal with Catholic Tradition, culture, history, and so much more. The goal of this campaign is to fund the production of GODSPEED - A CATHOLIC JOURNEY THROUGH LIFE! , our first game, and to provide the funds needed for additional game development.

Our goal is to raise a minimum of $82,000. Board game production in low volume is very costly. Therefore we have set a goal of a minimum of  2000 pre-ordered games. This volume gets us to a price point where we can keep the game affordable. The cost of these games plus shipping and handling runs close to $50,000. The remaining money will go toward more games, taxes, fees assessed by Indiegogo and PayPal, and to pay for the art and graphics needed for the next game.

 

PERKS

We hope you like the perks we chose:

  • Friend - First of all, our faith means everything to us and we felt that we wanted to pray for all of you that donate to the campaign. Outside of the Mass the Holy Rosary is our favorite prayer. We pray nightly and would like to include you in our prayer intentions.
  • Supporter -  one of our favorite places of worship is The National Shrine of Mary, Help of Christians at Holy Hill in Hubertus, Wisconsin. We will add a Mass intention on your behalf at the Shrine as a thank you for your donation.
  • Backer - This perk is a pre-order of the game GODSPEED - A CATHOLIC JOURNEY THROUGH LIFE!  Please consider them as gifts for your children and grandchildren for First Communion, birthday and Christmas.
  • Promoter - This perk gets you two games and a bonus CD called Jesu and Maria, professionally recorded by The Andress Sisters. You can hear a sample of the CD  here https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/jesu-and-mari...
  • Distributor - This perk is for anyone who would like to sell more games through their business. We have given a special distributor pricing as an incentive.
  • Advisor - this perk is a very special one in which you can participate in the development and testing of future games. If you are energized over getting good games into good homes, this might be the opportunity you have been looking for. We'd love to have new ideas and suggestions as we go through this process. Some restrictions may apply.

We are setting this up as a fixed campaign largely due to the need to achieve the 2000  game goal to keep the manufacturing costs down. If we don't approach it this way, we could end up paying more for production than the campaign can support. If the goal isn't achieved, then all the donations will be refunded back to you. This is all managed by Indiegogo and PayPal.

OUR TEAM

My family played a big part in developing GODSPEED – A CATHOLIC JOURNEY THROUGH LIFE. They were the artists, designers, critics, editors, and testers. We are very grateful to our friends who, in the next stage of development, tried it out!  This campaign brings together the things we love most- our Faith, family, friends, and games!

Just a note, the components in the videos are prototype level. The final product will have improvements incorporated.

While I've never brought a game to market, I do have practical experience in manufacturing as a leader of a manufacturing organization. I've been a part of design/manufacture/shipping functions my whole career, and feel I can manage those parts of this project safely.

RISKS

Like with any project there are some risks and challenges. We risk not achieving the goal and therefore not getting the product to market, which means it wouldn't be available to families that might like it. There is also risk that we might have to extend the campaign to reach the goal; we would only do this if we are close to achieving the goal.  If the goal were extended, we would not be able to ship the games prior to Christmas. You can greatly help avoid this problem by getting the word out and passing the campaign on to others you know.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

If you are not in a position to donate, we understand. However,  you could be a tremendous help to us by praying for success of the campaign. In addition, by passing on the information to others who may be able to donate or would like to pre-order a game you would be doing us a great favor. Indiegogo has many tools to help you get the word out.

story:
Lovecraft Tales is an adventure game based on short story written by the famous horror writer - Howard Phillips Lovecraft (you can read about him, in case you have no idea who the heck was this guy). The story in question is "The Whisperer in Darkness". While most games that are based on Lovecraft works are about Cthulhu (giant squid-like monster, quite overused I'd say), we want to give you something different. 



We've been doing it for quite long time, and we reached a pretty advanced stage of development. We laid foundation for the game, created framework for puzzle, day & night system, inventory, diary, possibility to walk throught the game world, systems like fear/insanity/hunger (although they are not implemented yet because there is not enough game content for them to make sense). We also created tons of art so you can experience beautiful and immersive environments.

It's not just an idea supported by no experience, like you often see, it's a real thing. It's the result of 3,5 years of work (approximately).

You don't have to believe only in words, you can download a playable prototype in case you missed the big graphic link above :).



H.P Lovecraft created genre called lovecraftian horror. It's bit different from classical horror, it's more depressive and misanthropic. 

One of it's topics is insignificance of mankind in the universe. In H.P. Lovecraft writings, history of mankind is rather meaningless and short, the world he created is filled with many different, alien beings and deities, that are far more powerful and intelligent than us... And not necessarily friendly. It's definitely not an anthropocentric world.

It's also about hopelessness and fragility of human psyche, because when Lovecraftian protagonist is finally discovering the truth about nature of universe, he loses his mind or breaks down, he just can't digest it.

Also, it's about fear of the unknown. It leaves opened questions - and maybe that's why it's so appealing, because it leaves lot of space for imagination.


Of course, we have mindset for bigger plan, but for now we want to focus on what's in front of our noses. Then, we can proceed further (and that's what stretch goals are made for). This basic release plan is crucial. 
Therefore, for finishing the 1st episode in this minimum plan, we need:

Finished story and gameplay


In our playable prototype you can have a taste of how game will look and feel, but there's not much in terms of actual gameplay. We have a game framework, and the next step is to fill it with actual content, create immersive story with beginning, end and some interesting turning points inside.
We have already designed the story - that will develop threads started in game prototype. It will be built upon that, but for now we're not telling more.
Of course, it will require much work to implement and it requires creating some new artworks and code (but the main focus is on the art because it will be the biggest part of work).

Redesigned and simplified interiors


We decided to do it based on feedback that we got from players so far. You all have foundd the interiors being too confusing for such simple buildings, so we will get rid of changing camera angles inside the buildings, and we will make all rooms connected rather than isolated like it's now. You will see building's structure while you're inside.

Maybe we will leave confusing camera turning for some special occasions, because maybe some areas will be maze-like, but it will be part of the stretch goals, when we achieve them

Death


Quite an important feature for a horror game, don't you agree?

In our prototype it's impossible to die, but this will change. We want to add much more tension. We're not sure yet if it will be permanent death or not. Ideally, we want to implement difficulty levels, but again, see stretch goals. For sure you will be able to die in some really nasty and dirty ways.

Cutscenes


They will fill gap between story and game itself, they are important thinga to introcude the hero, the story and the backgrounds, they provide some endings and hopefully some interludes. We won't go like Hollywood style, please don't expect that, it's not that kind of game and we don't have budget for that. They will have form of static screens with voiceover or partially animated movie frames that get frozen in time, depending on the total amount we will collect.

UI redesign

Currently the UI is outdated, it's a prototype that hasn't been touched much really, we only refined art to look decent enough. It was designed having a mobile game in mind, but things changed, so it doesn't make much sense anymore. It's a part of the game that I really want to change, badly.


Basically, we want to get rid of most UI elements or hide them whenever it's possible to make the game as immersive as possible. So no more old fashioned icons cluttering screen.

Dialogues

Currently there are no NPC-s in game, so you are quite alone. Of course, we wan to change that and add some life and interaction. Don't expect us to add a lot of them, though. In few key-locations you will be able to talk with some characters, and depending on how you run the conversation, you will learn different things. Also, don't expect NPC-s to act like idiots and answer same question over and over again... they will rather treat You like an idiot :). So, you will have to be mindful.


Gianni Chiarparini is an experienced music producer and composer who has collaborated successfully with popular artists, has scored for movies, commercials, documentaries and indie games. Gianni has just finished to compose the music for "Starcrafts Mod". He is the founder of Violet Music production where he teamed up with the very talented producer Simone Ermacora. Considering Gianni's big passion for Lovecraft (since his teenage years) and survival horror games, the match was obvious, Violet music production is composing REALLY dark ambient soundtrack for Lovecraft Tales, together with sound design. Music will play an important role in the game, so here you can have a taste of how it's going to be:


...And what's in it for you:


Sewer Hrehorowicz

I'm the creator of this game, and I've been working on it for about 3 years. Primarily I'm an artist, but I had to learn lot of different skills in order to finish what I began - like level design, sound design, game design, scripting, writing, project management to name few... But I like learning.

Edouard Bouchez

C# programmer that took challenge and has been working with me for almost 2 years, with no money... He is the most reliable person that I've ever worked with. He puts his time, energy, money and heart to this game and he is doing it at 100% like I do. For that, I will be eternally thankful.

Of course, we would not do it all alone. There were, and there are people that helped us in various ways, in most cases in exchange of profit in a distant future. It takes guts and heart to do this, so we want to honour them:

  • Gianni Chiarparini - he decided to compose all music and produce all sounds for game
  • Marek Nowak - he helped with the story a lot... really lot
  • Alicja Stempa - she helped with coding. You can admire day & night system and animated trees thanks to her
  • Evgeny Chucha - he animated the protagonist
  • Ted Garnie - he created some environmental artworks
  • Hubert Świątek - he composed the music for our previous trailer and made great jingle
  • Tobias Ezra Queen, Mark Talman, Paweł Mielewczyk - they provided great voiceovers
    • Dagmara Klimczak - she provided English translation for game
  • Robert Chrzanowski - he also animated the protagonist but we haven't had the chance to use it yet
  • Dominik Hrehorowicz - he placed all sounds in the levels and traced many bugs

And there are some people that decided to stay anonymous, although their contribution is visible and important. You may not be even aware of it...



We dedicated lot of time, energy and money for the development of Lovecraft Tales. I personally dedicated most of my time for 1,5 year, it hurt me financially. I haven't seen it coming, but it was inevitable. We released demo, but we can't go further without your support, and I personally can't do it for sure.

You can also understand that making games takes lot of money, and this time we set our goals really low because we already did a huge part of it.

We also didn't want to make deal with publisher so far, because we want to stay independent and follow our vision.

Besides that, for me personally it's a huge part of my life, that took an unimaginable amount of work and time... You don't expect that I will just give up onit away, do you?



Q: When the game will be finished?
A: It depends on stretch goals that we achieve. The more of them, the longer it'll take. I estimate 6 months for basic plan, and 1,5 year with all additional stretch goals.
Q: When I will get rewards?
A: Generally, after releasing the game. Some rewards may come earlier, though, like for example hangouts and membership site access.
Q: Why don't you promise more for that amount of money> You seem to be over-cautious
A: Yeah, I know that some people do that. You know, I'm trying to be realistic. We have some experience, we did a lot without any support, and we know how much it costs to add one simple feature. You honestly have no frickin idea.
Q: I don't like this and that, it could be done better. Why are you so sloppy?
A: Because I prefer sloppy success over perfect mediocrity. I like to get things done. You have no idea how many compromises we need to make in order to have things done.
Q: Where is your budget breakdown?
A: I won't post it because it's not fixed. We need to pay taxes, fees, rewards costs, but that's obvious. I need to have salary during development, but there are many many unpredicatble factors and we don't know yet what we will buy and what we will do. It depends on stretch goals. The more money we collect, the more people we will need to pay in general.
Q: Are there more questions to be answered?
A: Maybe, I don't know. It depends on you. Write to me if you have one, and I'll post it there.



Making such game ain't child's play. There are many unexpected problems, especially while you are a small player without years of prior experience as an artist, a coder, a designer, a producer, a marketer. Normally there is separate vacancy for each of these roles so you probably begin to realize that what we are doing is nearly impossible... But hey, that's life, it's about challenges, and challenges make you grow, sometimes really fast. Every great result come with price - you need to take a risk.

Exceeding deadline

It's the most common I believe and it happens all the time, not only to indie developers but to everyone. We are not different.

Running short on money

It can be more expensive that we plan. It was so far, and in our case time was currency, so we had to cut on features. Also, that's why we have stretch goals, because we want to be flexible and cut/add features when we need to. We rather want to have it done than make perfect, never finished game.

Losing teammates

It can happen, it's life, you know. Shit happens. We experienced it. Edouard was not with me from beginning, there was another programmer (who has same name by coincidence), and at some point I was alone. Honestly, for a moment I thought "It's over!", but guess what - it wasn't.

So, in conclusion - problems occur, and it's not only an issue with indie devs like us. It happens everywhere all the time and you don't even know about 90% of cases, because problems are solved.

...And our approach to problems is simple:
Over, under, around or through - whtever it takes, I'll do
Because in the end, it comes down to this attitude. People may bullshit you, because we all like to over-complicate simple things :)



If you like it - contribute. Now :). Tomorrow is never, you know how it works.

In few key-locations you will be able to talk with some characters, and depending on how you run the conversation, you will learn different things. Also, don't expect NPC-s to act like idiots and answer same question over and over again... they will rather treat You like an idiot :). So, you will have to be mindful. 


Gianni Chiarparini is an experienced music producer and composer who has collaborated successfully with popular artists, has scored for movies, commercials, documentaries and indie games. Gianni has just finished to compose the music for "Starcrafts Mod". He is the founder of Violet Music production where he teamed up with the very talented producer Simone Ermacora. Considering Gianni's big passion for Lovecraft (since his teenage years) and survival horror games, the match was obvious, Violet music production is composing REALLY dark ambient soundtrack for Lovecraft Tales, together with sound design. Music will play an important role in the game, so here you can have a taste of how it's going to be:




...And what's in it for you:





Sewer Hrehorowicz
I'm the creator of this game, and I've been working on it for about 3 years. Primarily I'm an artist, but I had to learn lot of different skills in order to finish what I began - like level design, sound design, game design, scripting, writing, project management to name few... But I like learning.
Edouard Bouchez
C# programmer that took challenge and has been working with me for almost 2 years, with no money... He is the most reliable person that I've ever worked with. He puts his time, energy, money and heart to this game and he is doing it at 100% like I do. For that, I will be eternally thankful.


Of course, we would not do it all alone. There were, and there are people that helped us in various ways, in most cases in exchange of profit in a distant future. It takes guts and heart to do this, so we want to honour them:


Gianni Chiarparini - he decided to compose all music and produce all sounds for game

Marek Nowak - he helped with the story a lot... really lot

Alicja Stempa - she helped with coding. You can admire day & night system and animated trees thanks to her

Evgeny Chucha - he animated the protagonist

Ted Garnie - he created some environmental artworks

Hubert Świątek - he composed the music for our previous trailer and made great jingle

Tobias Ezra Queen, Mark Talman, Paweł Mielewczyk - they provided great voiceovers
Dagmara Klimczak - she provided English translation for game

Robert Chrzanowski - he also animated the protagonist but we haven't had the chance to use it yet

Dominik Hrehorowicz - he placed all sounds in the levels and traced many bugs

And there are some people that decided to stay anonymous, although their contribution is visible and important. You may not be even aware of it...



We dedicated lot of time, energy and money for the development of Lovecraft Tales. I personally dedicated most of my time for 1,5 year, it hurt me financially. I haven't seen it coming, but it was inevitable. We released demo, but we can't go further without your support, and I personally can't do it for sure.

You can also understand that making games takes lot of money, and this time we set our goals really low because we already did a huge part of it.
We also didn't want to make deal with publisher so far, because we want to stay independent and follow our vision.
Besides that, for me personally it's a huge part of my life, that took an unimaginable amount of work and time... You don't expect that I will just give up onit away, do you?




Q: When the game will be finished?
A: It depends on stretch goals that we achieve. The more of them, the longer it'll take. I estimate 6 months for basic plan, and 1,5 year with all additional stretch goals.

Q: When I will get rewards?
A: Generally, after releasing the game. Some rewards may come earlier, though, like for example hangouts and membership site access.

Q: Why don't you promise more for that amount of money> You seem to be over-cautious
A: Yeah, I know that some people do that. You know, I'm trying to be realistic. We have some experience, we did a lot without any support, and we know how much it costs to add one simple feature. You honestly have no frickin idea.

Q: I don't like this and that, it could be done better. Why are you so sloppy?
A: Because I prefer sloppy success over perfect mediocrity. I like to get things done. You have no idea how many compromises we need to make in order to have things done.

Q: Where is your budget breakdown?
A: I won't post it because it's not fixed. We need to pay taxes, fees, rewards costs, but that's obvious. I need to have salary during development, but there are many many unpredicatble factors and we don't know yet what we will buy and what we will do. It depends on stretch goals. The more money we collect, the more people we will need to pay in general.

Q: Are there more questions to be answered?
A: Maybe, I don't know. It depends on you. Write to me if you have one, and I'll post it there.





Making such game ain't child's play. There are many unexpected problems, especially while you are a small player without years of prior experience as an artist, a coder, a designer, a producer, a marketer. Normally there is separate vacancy for each of these roles so you probably begin to realize that what we are doing is nearly impossible... But hey, that's life, it's about challenges, and challenges make you grow, sometimes really fast. Every great result come with price - you need to take a risk.
Exceeding deadline
It's the most common I believe and it happens all the time, not only to indie developers but to everyone. We are not different.
Running short on money
It can be more expensive that we plan. It was so far, and in our case time was currency, so we had to cut on features. Also, that's why we have stretch goals, because we want to be flexible and cut/add features when we need to. We rather want to have it done than make perfect, never finished game.

Losing teammates
It can happen, it's life, you know. Shit happens. We experienced it. Edouard was not with me from beginning, there was another programmer (who has same name by coincidence), and at some point I was alone. Honestly, for a moment I thought "It's over!", but guess what - it wasn't. 
So, in conclusion - problems occur, and it's not only an issue with indie devs like us. It happens everywhere all the time and you don't even know about 90% of cases, because problems are solved.

...And our approach to problems is simple:Over, under, around or through - whtever it takes, I'll doBecause in the end, it comes down to this attitude. People may bullshit you, because we all like to over-complicate simple things :)


If you like it - contribute. Now :). Tomorrow is never, you know how it works.

story:
The Evil VR is an unique horror experience designed for PC and Virtual Reality. Use your Oculus Rift, HTC Vive or standard mouse and keyboard to enjoy this pioneering new experience.

Originally released for Gear VR and Google Daydream,The Evil VR has been a long time passion project for us, and we're very excited to show you what we've been working on.

August 25th, 1967. Jessica Müller never found out what happened to her family in Germany when she was a child. She became an orphan very young and has been adopted by an american family which turned back to the US in 1955. Jessica was to that time 11 years old. She never forgot the dramatic pictures of her childhood.


Over the years hatred and fear produced an abnormal behaviour and as member of the Anti-psychiatry movement she doesn't believe in psychological supervision.

This year Jessica became 23 years old and decided to visit her home in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Her adoptive father Howard worked in the Edwards Barracks in the district "Preungesheim" before her biological parents went missing. Jessica want answers, answers in a time when the german society kept quiet about the happenings of the second world war.

We think the best game is one designed together with the community. Approved by lovers and designed with the creativity of horror-genre players we can create the most unique horror game experience

Play @Oculus: https://buff.ly/2iE0BtQ⠀
Play @GoogleVR: https://buff.ly/2vRcVs8
Play @Cardboard: http://bit.ly/2f6c3dx

As we already mentioned The Evil VR is not a completly new project from stretch. Already 2016 we went live with a playable alpha version for Google Cardboard. Meanwhile we were able continue the development and released the final mobile version, which is already available for Samsung GearVR, Cardboard and Google Daydream.

For the PC Version we´re going to use highres textures and much more visual effects as for the mobile version!
 

We work very close with the gaming community on mobile platforms, and now we would like to share some of our favorite reaction videos.

Youtuber k1k3 already scared his wits out while playing an early developer build!


 Also the awesome Youtuber Omega Play got shocked!

One of our latest favorites from Puretonto gamer

 

We can always do better, so let´s have a look on our vision:

NON-VR & VR Version - Let´s keep it simple.
The game will be developed separately for each platform. In that way the user experience on pc  will be completely different from the vr version and not just an imported pc version into vr.

Extended Story - The story and world of The Evil offers a lot more than you might think.
The extended storyline opens up new chapters of  the evil. We want to be able to integrate the whole terrifying storyline with flashbacks from the past.

Crafting System - Are you ready to build useful items and expand the horror experience?
With the crafting system included, the world of the evil will get more complex and interactive. The player will have more challanging riddles and a more open style of playing.

Dialog System and Voice Acting - The  voices wil haunt you.
The dialog system will create a more livelily and realistic world, with more complex ways of playing and interacting with the world and characters. Filled with voices recorded by industry professionals.

Motion Capturing - Emotions captured by industry professional.
If we reach this milestone, we want to take the chance and include motion capturing into the Evil VR. We will make the other characters as realistic as possible. Emotions like fear and hate can be felt best when using an authentic face expressions.

Further Goals ???
If we reach beyond this point, we are simply going to ask you guys what you would wish further to be in the game. Detailed Milestones would be published while the development then.


We´re blackHound Studios, two indie developer with a lot of passion and craziness. We started together in June 2016 and until now we published a lot of casual mobile games and also The Evil VR. Besides we´re working also in part-time jobs. After a year we´ve realized that we can´t continue our way like this. We´re simply too slow. So what we hope is to raise The Evil VR now and create the game full-time with the community.

The mobile version of The Evil VR was simply a first version to manifest our ideas and to get the experience we needed to make in the horror genre. Many of the core mechanics of the game have been already implemented, but we want to expand them and there's still a long way to go in terms of design, content, and polish. The whole story needs to be told inside the game, with all facets of it.  We also want to bring a sound engineer on board for an awesome aural experience.

The funds from this campaign will help push beyond the past and it will help us finish The Evil VR. With your support, we can finalize what we began one year ago. The Evil VR release for the PC. Let create a unique Horror-Adventure together!

 

 

Eyüp Zengin (The Machine)

This guy is the heart of the team. He studied computer science and is a funny, but brilliant guy. Very young he became obsessed with computers and video games, after he bought his first graphic card, an GeForce FX5200. Over the years his passion for games grew stronger and he  decided to use his passion and fullfill a lifelong dream by working in several gaming related projects, including AI and 2D Games. But he has also worked in different areas like web development. When he is not coding, he is  designing awesome  2D and 3D content for games and media. His everyday life is basically all about games and his passion. He´s also a bit of a weirdo, in his free time he buys a huge amount of candles and nobody knows what he´s using them for. Like all of the team members, Eyüp is a creative mind and also passionate gamer.
Top Games: Resident Evil 1-4, Clock Tower, Obscure, Minecraft, Anno, StarCraft, TES Oblivion, Half Life, Crysis

Alexander Johannes (The Magician)

This guy always has an ace up his sleeve. Alex also has studied computer science and is a actuall magician. His passion for games started early in the 90´s with the discovery of the Sega Saturn. From that moment on he´s been in love with video games. He started creating simple RPG type games at the age of 12 with the help of the RPG Maker 2000. He´s been also working in a field of different Projects, including non Games. He has worked on mobile Applications, Web development ,VR and Games. When it comes to developing games his goal is clear; creating a unique and emotional experience, with emotions ranging from positiv emotions like happiness or love to negative emotions like fear and hatered.
Top Games: Silent Hill 2, Amnesia, Outlast, Elderscrolls 3-5, Witcher trillogy, Havy Rain, Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time

An agile project team

In new projects we usually work together with experienced artists from a range of fields. We have also worked with professional game designers  from studios like Ubisoft or Sony. Those artists are flexible team members with a lot of experience in their various fields like graphic design ,sound engineering or game design. This assures a certain quality of our games and helpes us to create something meaningful. To assure the success of a project, while working with so many creative heads, we have a stable and structured workflow.

story:
About me:

My name is Reckless and i'm a solo developer on the title Zachariah, i am making this campaign to hopefully improve the game entirely and ultimately be ready for release.

 

Overview:

Zachariah is a multiplayer or single-player hardcore base building survival game. 
You start of stranded, in an area of 3 main islands and 4 mini islands; With lack of items, survival knowledge and you have to test your own survival skills to survive. Your aim to survive is crucial, especially during the nighttime, where things are more harsh. Getting things ready during the day is key. 

 

Backer Goals:

 

£100:

Reaching this goal will allow me to add needed content into Zachariah, this includes Meshes, icons, sound effects, improve fps,

 

£200:

This will help me change the whole inventory system.

story:
Glimpse of Madness is a visually-rich 2D point and click adventure game inspired by all the '80 & '90 classic games. The game mainly deals with thrillers, investigations and the supernatural world, but combines this with more lighthearted and fun themes.

Will you help Ana Lucia to solve the mystery of her parents' death?

Here is the english trailer:

And here is a collection of gameplay locations:



 

• Game engine developed through Visionaire 5 engine, by Visionaire Studio UG
• 20 different locations in which to move, interacting with multiple objects and characters
• More 10 different locations (30 total): required amount: 10.000 Euro REACHED
• Additional 10 different locations (40 total): required amount: 12.000 Euro REACHED
• Bilingual texts and interface (English & Italian)
• Other language text (French, German & Spanish): required amount: 10.000 Euro REACHED
• A very large amount of fun puzzles and objects to collect for your inventory!
• Dialogues with different characters, to discover useful clues and reach the solution
• Accurate movements of the various characters, depending on the action required
• Presence of spoken audio in English language.
• Sounds and music by Eric Matyas (www.soundimage.org)
• Versions of the game in Windows and Mac format
• Digital download plus many other features like walkthrough, illustrated artbook etc.

The game demo (7 locations), in Windows and Mac format, is available on the website glimpseofmadness.com



The user will guide the main character Ana Lucia through the multiple locations that characterize the game. During the course of the adventure Ana Lucia will meet several characters who will help or hinder her in her search for truth!


Below we present some of the main characters, who Ana Lucia will have the opportunity to converse or exchange objects with, to continue in the solution of the plot.


Ana Lucia:
After graduating from college, Ana Lucia returns home only to lose her parents in an mysterious incident.
Mark:
Ana Lucia's boyfriend, will play an important role in the game. 



Onze:
A valuable informant, based in Mexico.
Theresa:
A very mysterious lady from the past.

Tricky:
A shady and dangerous guy.
Ataahua:
A precious friend who will help Ana in her search.

Rebecca:
A mysterious charming fortune-teller.
The Doctors:
Working in the Istitute, will they be allies or enemies?

Chief Henry:
The strong arm of the law.
Rachel:
She is a mysterious adventurer.



Glimpse of Madness is a complex software and takes a long time to be designed and refined. This is why we ask you to help us with the expenses to complete the game that we have in mind! The more we get, the more we will develop and enrich the story, with more locations and subtitles in different languages!

These are the costs for the 20 locations version:


With an extra funding of € 2000 we'll be able to give the game another 10 locations to play. And, finally, to produce the whole story that we've in mind, we need € 2000 more and we'll develop a magnificent 40 locations adventure game!



Hijacked Minds Studios is a software development team specialized in point’n’click adventure games, consisting of Lorenzo and Giada Erba (lead programmers) and Davide Civelli (level & characters graphic designer), based in Villa Guardia (CO) in Italy.

In early ‘90s, the team completed the development of a first-person, western-style adventure, "The West Bandits", on the Commodore Amiga® platform, which however will never be published.

Over the past two years Hijacked Minds Studios has been developing a new adventure, in the style of the most classic point’n’click adventure games, but without following the path of "pixel art", preferring instead to develop high definition graphics, the developers use dedicated software such as Newtek Lightwave 3D® (used since Amiga times), Daz Studio® (for the characters and their respective movements), Corel Video Studio® for the intro and cutscenes, as well as Adobe Photoshop® for the interface and to mix everything.

Hijacked Minds Studios chose Visionaire Studio 5® as game engine, as it was specifically designed for the development of games that the team had in mind to produce.

From this development effort comes "Glimpse of Madness", a classic point and click adventure with an ‘80s and ‘90s adventure production style.

story:
Short Summary


The first release for Android devices is now available at the Google Play Store . Enjoy.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.archteon.barbarianprince

Barbarian Prince is a fantasy tabletop game from the early eighties. The game is like a roguelike played on a map. This means while travelling on the map a series of random events or encounters occur so that whenever you play the game it will be a different experience. The only problem with such a game though is the rules reading and continuous dice rolling. The idea is to make a digital version of the game itself which could also be used as a basis for the development of a series of similar games.


What We Need & What You Get

As a programmer I have always been involved in game development at a personal level. When flash was more popular I developed the Gemstone Dragon RPG still alive at http://www.gemstonedragon.com/

In the new era of tablets and mobile devices I would like to use my experience with programming (by profession) with my love for role playing games to bring this tabletop game to life.

There is already a working codebase for android. As I was trying to see if something like this would be possilbe I started the project development. As I said I want to use this as a basis for a few similar type of games but any funding would be of great help to me to accelerate development and realize this specific tabletop game by implementing all the rules and events.

The final product will be free with monetization features typical for android apps like advertisements.

It would also be possible for me to share or sell the source code of the app to interested developers to build upon or modify as they wish.


Risk Free

Since there is already a working code base for android I expect that the rules implementation will not go beyond the timespan of 40 to 60 days maximum to complete the final product.


Thank you very much

Any contribution will be greatly appreciated. If you like role playing games or tabletop hex games and would like to have one on your mobile device then please fund this project or try to spread the word to people who might be interested. Thank you for taking the time to read this introduction.
story_txt:
Short Summary
The first release for Android devices is now available at the Google Play Store . Enjoy.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.archteon.barbarianprinceBarbarian Prince is a fantasy tabletop game from the early eighties. The game is like a roguelike played on a map. This means while travelling on the map a series of random events or encounters occur so that whenever you play the game it will be a different experience. The only problem with such a game though is the rules reading and continuous dice rolling. The idea is to make a digital version of the game itself which could also be used as a basis for the development of a series of similar games.
  
What We Need & What You GetAs a programmer I have always been involved in game development at a personal level. When flash was more popular I developed the Gemstone Dragon RPG still alive at http://www.gemstonedragon.com/ In the new era of tablets and mobile devices I would like to use my experience with programming (by profession) with my love for role playing games to bring this tabletop game to life. There is already a working codebase for android. As I was trying to see if something like this would be possilbe I started the project development. As I said I want to use this as a basis for a few similar type of games but any funding would be of great help to me to accelerate development and realize this specific tabletop game by implementing all the rules and events.The final product will be free with monetization features typical for android apps like advertisements.It would also be possible for me to share or sell the source code of the app to interested developers to build upon or modify as they wish.   
Risk FreeSince there is already a working code base for android I expect that the rules implementation will not go beyond the timespan of 40 to 60 days maximum to complete the final product.    
Thank you very muchAny contribution will be greatly appreciated. If you like role playing games or tabletop hex games and would like to have one on your mobile device then please fund this project or try to spread the word to people who might be interested. Thank you for taking the time to read this introduction.

story:
Arkalica isn’t just another piece of rock to simply explore and be done with, but a treasure trove of opportunity just waiting to be discovered. The teaser trailer will give you a quick overview of a few things you can expect to find in Arkalica with a more detailed description below and on our website at www.arkalica.com. All content is still in pre-alpha and will likely be modified during development.

We have some good news for everyone that has been following us for a while and for those of you just hearing about Arkalica for the first time. None of Arkalica’s elemental specializations have been made public yet, but during this campaign we will introduce a new element each day over the course of the project’s duration in the updates section. These will be added to our website as well, so you can head on over to check them out whenever you like after the project comes to an end.

Now without further ado, here are a few things you can expect to find in Arkalica:

 

Open World

In Arkalica, you decide what you want to do and where you want to go. Arkalica will continue to grow, adding more places to explore and tons of new dungeons and Lytes for you to conquer and tame. Enjoy hours of entertainment with a multitude of quest lines filled to the brim with exciting discoveries, plot twists, wit and most importantly: loot.

If you feel like you’ve seen everything Arkalica has to offer, go out and explore it again. Arkalica consists of massive areas filled with wide open spaces for you to run through and tiny nooks and crannies to explore so chances are that you missed a few things. Decide whether you want to battle along the way, or turn off encounters completely allowing you a more relaxed and casual experience.

If you’re looking for something a little more action packed, find and challenge NPCs to be granted access to a dynamic tournament. Battle and struggle your way to the top and be rewarded each and every time for your achievements. Enter one of the hundreds of dungeons and test your mettle, but just like encounters dungeons will not be a predetermined instance. Every time you re-enter a dungeon it will be different, rewarding you with not only a new experience, but with a different set of lootable items.

If it all starts feeling a little mundane and you feel like you need a change of pace then dip a toe into our massive crafting system or make it your mission to build yourself a house. Create cosmetic items and play dress-up as you search for the perfect outfit to compliment yourself and your Lytes alike. Play around with your builds, making your Lytes not only the cutest creatures to walk the face of Arkalica, but also a force to be reckoned with.

 

Taming and Transformation System

Arkalica has a unique system in place which allows you not only to capture any creature you have beaten in combat, but also enables you to transform into any creature you have tamed.

The taming system is unique in that capturing a Lyte isn’t just a straightforward action that will eventually become mundane and repetitive. Each action you take can lead to a myriad of results and you have to stay on your toes if you want to make the creature in question submit to you. Overcome peril and frustration with keen perception and strategic positioning as you adapt to your prey’s emotional state and reap the rewards when you finally succeed in taming your new companion.

Each Lyte species comes with 5 forms depending on the affinity to the elements it was born with. As an infant, or tier 1 Lyte, your companions and enemies will all be bound by two basic elements which will later on dictate the specialization elements available to it.

After gaining enough affinity with the elements, your Lyte will grow and become an adolescent, gaining a nice stat boost, but still retaining its two basic elements.

Having reached a high enough total affinity, your Lyte will mature into a tier 3, not only enjoying another nice stat boost, but also gaining access to its specializations. Each Lyte has two specializations linking back to its basic elements. Having unlocked these specializations will allow you to switch freely between them, even during combat.

 

Skill and Affinity System

Affinity in Arkalica can be considered levels and essentially work in the same way. A higher affinity will allow you a bigger selection of skills and passive abilities and also improve your overall combat prowess.

Arkalica currently has 30 specializations based on the two basic elements each Lyte has. The basic elements in Arkalica consist of the water, fire, earth, air, light and darkness system seen in a myriad of worlds, but that’s basically where the similarity ends.

Each Lyte essentially has access to four elements, giving you access to 64 elemental skills and two skill bars for every Lyte you own, but that’s not all. Arkalica’s skill system will allow you to modify each skill with a separate passive tree, allowing you to not only upgrade that boring old fireball, but also giving you the option of turning it into something a little less mainstream.

Every Lyte will have a passive skill tree for each of their elemental affinities. These passive trees will allow you to upgrade your Lyte and to choose your play-style. Experiment with different combinations and change your build on the fly. On top of being able to choose a build for each and every Lyte you own, you the player will also get passive trees for every element available in game allowing you to choose your overall interaction with your Lytes and the elements they wield.

 

 

Combat

Every combat system out there just feels a little lacking after a while, even when it itself is not at fault. Combat starts to feel mundane and repetitive and no amount of new content ever feels like it truly made much of a difference. In Arkalica, we’ve done away with these combat systems and instead created our own.

Each encounter will be instanced based, but not predetermined. Enemies, skill sets, environment and the type of battle will be randomly determined at the start of an encounter. Even two Lytes of the same species with the same affinity levels won’t be the same, but will come with stat and skill set differences. This will remain true for dungeons as well, the only difference being that the entire dungeon will count as an encounter. Dungeons aren’t hard-coded and the amount and type of enemies will vary on each subsequent visit.

Actual combat will involve basic attacks, more powerful charged attacks, evasion techniques, movement abilities, blocking, and your eight elemental skills. Almost every action will rely on a stamina pool which regenerates while in combat, but will never render you incapable of surviving a fight.

A player is limited to carrying three Lytes at a time, giving a possible combination of 12 elements and an arsenal of 48 chosen skills at any given time with which to beat your enemies into submission. Each Lyte has the ability to switch freely between unlocked specializations during combat, giving you a second skillset and allowing you to adapt to almost any situation on the fly.

And have we mentioned that you can even use the environment to your advantage? You'll have environmental interaction available during combat allowing you to scale walls, springboard and pull off some insane, never before seen moves as you pummel your enemies into oblivion.

 

 

Player Housing and Farming Systems

Traveling the world isn’t half as satisfying as having a place to return to at the end of the day. As part of the introduction to the game, the player will be given a little plot of land on which to build themselves a place to rest their aching feet.

This little piece of land can be expanded as the player progresses through the game, enabling them to turn the newly obtained space into farmland, a mine or two, a beautiful garden and that’s just to name a few. Gather resources and craft furniture and tools to make life easier for both you and your Lytes.

In Arkalica the basic elements even govern something as simple as planting a field of crops. Make use of your Lytes to help you out around your farm and eventually train them to do the work by themselves while you are out exploring the world.

Fishing in Arkalica is nice, easy and relaxing. All you need is a rod, some bait, a place to drop your line and maybe a good book or two. Or train your Lytes to catch fish on their own allowing you to sit back and take a load off.

The farming and fishing systems both come with their own passive trees and affinity levels, allowing you to mold your experience to better suit your needs. Cooking completes the set as a possible avenue for processing raw ingredients into something a little more useful either for use or for making a little money.

 

Crafting and Gathering Resources

Resources in Arkalica can be gathered in a myriad of ways. The easiest and most common way of obtaining items will be through combat. Enemies will drop both normal materials and valuables upon defeat. Other materials can be grown, bought or gathered from nodes found throughout the world.

These materials can be used to craft hundreds of items allowing you not only to gear up your creatures, but yourself as well. Every piece of gear gathered will have its appearance saved in a wardrobe system allowing you to use this system to change your look at any time if you dislike a certain piece of gear. Get rewards for collecting outfits and rare pieces of clothing.

Almost every single piece of gear and clothing can be crafted and each piece will be priced according to how much effort is usually required to craft said item making crafting not only useful, but profitable as well.

 

Treasure Hunting and Secrets

Arkalica is filled to the brim with hidden locations, awe inspiring scenery and dark, foreboding secrets all of which lead to treasure in some way or another. With the world having barely been explored in the short time since humanity had moved to Arkalica, you will find yourself on the forefront of discovery. Brave dangerous environments to track down lost artifacts, buried treasure and forgotten secrets that could change the world..

Or if you normally jump at your own shadow and want something a little more nerve friendly, go on a fun treasure hunt that will take you to exotic locations without all those horrid, dark and deadly, shadow filled pools of endless abyss.

 

 

Hexalyte CCG

If collecting outfits and playing dress up isn’t your thing, but you still fancy yourself somewhat of a collector we have just the thing for you. Hexalyte is a card based game enjoyed by the masses in Arkalica. It’s a game of skill, wit and memory as you imitate Lyte battles on a flat surface, but a lot of people just enjoy collecting the cards.

With hundreds of cards to collect you will find yourself searching high and low to complete your collection. Obtain cards through combat, in secret locations, or buy them from NPCs. Certain cards can only be obtained by completing certain tasks, but other than those select few there’s nothing standing in your way to tabletop domination!

 

 

 

These are just a few of the things that you can expect in Arkalica. Production has only started a short while ago, so unfortunately completion of the first release is still a few years off. Fear not however, after the initial release Arkalica will continue to grow through expansions and free content DLCs. Currently we have planned far enough ahead and we have enough content for at least three full expansions and several major content updates that will be released as free DLCs.

These include but aren’t limited to massive dungeons bordering on insane, new combat systems that allow for combat while in your humanoid form, new specialization elements, more starting stories, thousands of new quests and a multitude of new maps.

 

Funding

Some of you might be looking at our target, whistling in disbelief, but that is in fact what we estimate the minimum required for completing development on the first installment of Arkalica to be. Up until now all expenses were covered by making use of personal savings, but unfortunately that in itself is not a never ending waterfall of golden coins.

There aren't currently any specific amounts allocated to certain aspects of the game and all funds will go toward development of all phases and aspects of Arkalica, including the upgrade and maintenance of equipment, facilities and several truck loads of coffee beans to keep us going through some of those long nights.

Anything pledged above the target will go to further improving elements of the game and might even carry over into new expansions and content that we haven't even thought about yet.

If for whatever reason we are unable to hit our target the first time, a second, third or millionth attempt will be made. Arkalica is happening even if we have to sell our internal organs at the end of the day to fund it.

 

Perks

A lot of campaigns promise physical objects or exclusive in-game items as rewards for donating a certain amount, but we feel that even though owning a one of a kind coffee mug or a sparkling outfit in-game would be awesome, the majority of the community will essentially be left out. So we went about rewards a little differently.

Instead of you, the backer, getting exclusive content, you instead become a part of Arkalica. Be revered  throughout Arkalica with your name, logo or photo plastered on billboards, outfits and walls throughout the city. Struggle and battle your way through a dungeon you yourself designed or marvel at your writing skills as you explore that quest line you created. And if those rewards are a little out of reach with the current state of your wallet, then revel in the knowledge that your name is engraved firmly not only in our hearts, but also the credits that will be displayed in several places inside as well as out of the game.

For those of you that like us feel that perks can't be properly defined due to the small amount of description space available to each perk, we'll be adding a detailed description of each perk and what it entails in the update section shortly after the campaign going live, so head on over if there are a few things you would like clarified.

We would also like to ask you for your patience. A large amount of perk rewards will require some time to complete, but they will be completed that we assure you. Recognition will be given to each and every person that helped to fund our project, inside the game as well as outside of it. You helped us and you deserve being recognized, and so you shall.

 

How you can help us without donating

A lot of people won't be able to support us through funding, and we get that, being dirt poor ourselves at the moment, but a lot of you have half a million friends on Facebook and other social media sites which in itself is quite impressive. We implore you to share this campaign anywhere and everywhere, to the edges of the earth, galaxy and universe if possible, as failure is ensured if almost no one knows about it in the first place.

In the meantime we won't be sitting on our tail-ends twiddling our thumbs; we'll actively be seeking out support in all avenues available to us as well as continuing the development of Arkalica.

 

Thank you

Lastly we would like to thank each and everyone of you, whether you donated something, supported us in other ways or even just took the time to read through this wall of text. We appreciate it and we hope to return that devotion in the form of a quality game the likes of which have never been seen before.

Sincerely, thank you.
