story:
You are here, because you use or plan to use WordPress connected with IP.board. Then I am the matchmaker.

Single Sign On

Single Sign On means, that accounts of different eco-systems are synced to each other. This includes:

  • Login Status
  • Account Creation
  • Account Delete
  • Username changes
  • Password changes
  • Email Changes

This will be included within the Core functionality of both, IPBWI API and IPBWI for WordPress.

All Features are designed to be updatesave and have multi-language support.

IPBWI API and IPBWI for WordPress?

IPBWI stands for Invision Power Board Website Integration.

As connecting WordPress and IP.board, this software delivers a niche of a niche, as it required that target group use both softwares and decide to connect them to each other. This results in a small market which results in limited amount of sales for a high complex software.

I will deliver two products: IPBWI API and IPBWI for WordPress. While the API will be licensed to GPL and have no further restrictions on it, it will allow you to develop your own awesome features and plugins regardless which PHP software you want IP.board integrate into.

IPBWI for WordPress will have a probritary license and will use IPBWI API to allow deep integration between WordPress and IP.board. This will result in working Single Sign On, fancy Widgets and other integration Features as well as custom addons through IPBWI API.

Pledge Goals

2,500 € - Member API

IPBWI API: functions to view member information

3,000 € Topics API

IPBWI API: functions to list and view topics and posts

3,500 € - Topics Widget

IPBWI for WordPress: List Topics Widget with different order options

4,000 € - Messaging API

IPBWI API: functions to list and view private messages

4,500 € - Messages Widget

IPBWI for WordPress: List Messages Widget of currently logged in user

5,000 € - Permissions API

IPBWI API: user can... functions

IPBWI for WordPress: Widgets check wether current user can view content

6,000 € - Content Creation API

IPBWI API: Create Messages, Topics and Posts with API

That's not the end:

More Pledge Goals will be announced once second last arrived. Even if pledge goals are not achieved, I'll plan to extend both, API- and WordPress' Plugin featureset, but it will take a serious amount of time longer.

Learnings from v3 - what will be better in v4?

Since I've maintenanced v3 many years, there are new possibilities now. Invisionpower has improved the Single Sign On interfaces while WordPress has become a very stable plattform for online-publishing and services. The following advantages will be achieved in v4:

  • Extensive use of Action- and Filter-Hooks in WordPress
  • Easier custom addons integration
  • Performance Boost
  • Way more stability
  • Well Documented code and features
  • No inherited waste: Everything will be developed from the scratch
  • Better Usabillity: Your feedback during beta will help me to make features easier to use

Requirements for using the software

At this point of project status, the following requirements are set for using the software:

  • Latest Version of WordPress 4.3.x
  • Latest Version of IP.board 4.x
  • LAMP (Linux Apache MySQL PHP) Hosting Environment
  • PHP 5.5, but this may switch to PHP 7 if stable enough (much more performance!)
  • Latest Ioncube Loader for IPBWI for WordPress
  • Download Version of IP.board - The Cloud-Package will not work with this software.
  • WordPress and IP.board need to be on the same server/host with direct/local file access to each other.

What means Single Domain License?

This license will allow you to use the software for a domain (like ipbwi.com) plus unlimited subdomains (like docs.ipbwi.com) for an unlimited amount of time - the license or software does not call back home (except for update notifications) and it has no "turn off" trigger. On the other hand, you'll not be able to "deactivate" or "switch" a license, once binded on a domain, to another domain. Owners of the multi-packages can bind each license included later and don't need to decide for a domain instantly. During beta, IPBWI for WordPress will be distributed as time-expiring encoded package without any domain limitations.

Why encoded files?

The market for the WordPress plugin isn't that big as you may think, so each license saled is required to finance future development and maintenance. Once my software is released on a pirate's site, license sales would decrease instantly.

Please note, that you'll have enough possibilities to influence behavior of the plugin and customize it's output, even more than in the old IPBWI for WordPress v3 version.

Do I get a proper invoice?

Yes, we will create an invoice for each pledger following German Tax Laws. All prices include 19% German Value-Added-Tax (VAT).

How long is support?

The support options offered in the packages are starting once funding is finished and last until end of february of 2017. Support is offered for IPBWI and IPBWI for WordPress related questions, but not for consultance (except Tier 1 Beta Members) how to integrate or how to use IPBWI/(for WordPress) and/or any questions about PHP or programming help or something else. Users of IPBWI API should be able to develop features by theirself. My Support will help if there is an issue with the features my products provide. There will be docs for both, IPBWI and IPBWI for WordPress users to give you enough information for starting and unleash all the power of both softwares.

What are the packages / prices once released?

  • IPBWI - API access incl. 12 months of updates: 49 €, Renewal: 49 € / yearly
  • IPBWI for WordPress Single Domain License incl. 12 months of updates: 179 EUR, Renewal for Updates: 99 € / yearly
  • IPBWI for WordPress Multi Licenses: no plans to continue offering this except in this crowdfunding campaign.

Risks

I've earned enough experience since start of IPBWI 3 and IPBWI for WordPress 3 to understand how difficult and time consuming the creation and maintenance of a Single Sign On Bridge could be.

There is a risk that IP.board 4 has unseen lack of documentation in important sections, so I'll need to dig deep into IP.board's code. Worst case here could be a small delay for the pledge goals, but not for the core SSO featureset, as I've planned with a big buffer to make sure to deliver on time.

If the funding goal is not reached, this does not mean IPBWI and IPBWI for WordPress v4 will not be developed, but it will result in longer development time and the ETA "when it's done". There will be no second try, so if this crowd funding project is not successful, I'll not start a second one.

Spread the Word!

You can support this project by sharing it on social media!

story:
Terror From Below is a horror first-person shooter. Players will exterminate swarms of deadly, radioactive ants, that were created by the birth of the atomic age. Explore massive underground tunnel networks with the intent to rid the world of these man-made monsters.  Players will be able to choose from one of three game modes that will fit their play style and allow them to progress through the game at their own pace.

The brain child of a dedicated game development team, Terror From Below is our passion. We have built out the initial framework and we request your help to polish out the game.

We realize that there are three audiences for new games:

  • People that want to know when a game is scheduled for its production release - SIGN UP HERE
  • People that want to follow the development of the game and get notified of the production release - SIGN UP HERE
  • People that want to contribute as the game develops and see it evolve to the production release - The information below is for people that want to contribute. 

As developers, we wanted "Terror From Below' to tackle a niche genre that had not been fully explored while also providing appeal to a wide variety of player types. We are building upon the principality of fun with the understanding that fun comes in a variety of flavors.

We are building the game to accommodate the gamer types of run-and-gun, adventure, and role-play.

Our team has its varied preferences between single player and multiplayer games. So, we set out to prepare each game mode to accommodate single player or co-op team-play.

  • Survival - (run-and-gun)
    • All you need here is guns and more guns for this game mode, as you prepare your defenses - or your offenses- against endless rounds of enemy swarms.
    • A true blood-pumping-adrenaline rush-fight-to-the-death.
  • Campaign mode - (adventure)
    • You can begin the story's mystery-adventure with the cast of TFB to embark on a series of missions to unveil the terror from below the New Mexico desert.
    • Free-Roam - (role-play)
      • Take things easy and at your own-pace in this open sandbox.
      • Customizable settings and open access to all of the game's unlock-able content to let you play without the distraction of missions.

    We also intend to implement a unique Game Progression System

    • Achievement System
      • Play the game to unlock new weapons and collectibles by completing achievements.
        • Achievements per game mode.
        • Achievements across multiple game modes.

     

     

     

     

     

    Check out our Sample music track! Shout out to Dylan Zenner!

     

     

     

    You might be thinking - "Is $30,000 really enough to produce this game in less than a year? If you really have a dedicated development team then 60% of $30k is just $18k, that cannot possibly be enough money to split between the team."

    We thought through our budget very carefully. As we have mentioned before, we are going to release the game no matter what. We have completed the initial framework that allows us to add in new features at a lightning pace. (check our daily updates) We can guarantee that with the full amount in funding we can release this game on time.

    All the work that we have put into Terror From Below has been out of pocket and a labor of love. One of the many reasons we chose Indiegogo was because of the flexible campaign. We will release this game whether or not we receive additional funds. Our goal is a simple one, yet valiant one: make a fun game. We have reached a critical point where the project is big enough that we are now seeking out additional funds.

    We will use these funds to both accelerate the completion of Terror From Below and improve the overall quality of the finished game. We want to finish a quality game that we are satisfied with classifying as 'fun'.  This is where you can help.

    • Purchase one of our many perks (simple, yet effective)
    • Help spread the word!. It costs nothing. Share the link to this campaign.
    • WE WANT YOUR FEEDBACK!!!
      • We want your feedback on tweaking the game to achieve your desired play experience. We have grown up as gamers and all too often we see big development shops sacrifice game play for the sake of monetary gain.
    • Even if this is not your type of game, we welcome all contributions. Please join our community and help contribute feedback for future content. 

    Check out the perks! Make sure you select the perk that includes what you want. There are several to choose from. Here is a list of all of the possible perks:

    • Digital wallpaper pack
    • Your name in the credits
    • Alpha access key
    • Beta access key
    • TFB game access key
    • TFB T-shirt
    • Main theme soundtrack

     

    Dirt kicks up behind your truck as you make your way off the payment and onto the dirt road. The small, abandoned town is not far off of the road. It sits about 50 miles Southeast of the Trinity Site and not too far from Three Rivers. This small town, not present on any map, was abandoned several years ago. Another casually of the atomic age and its testing. You can see a dust devil making its way across the sage brush infested valley as you pull in front of the few remaining, but dilapidated, buildings.

    You find six vehicles without occupants nearby. You recognize one as belonging  to Mrs. Sally Johansson of Alamogordo. Another is a military police jeep. It must be from Holloman Air Force Base. You don't recognize the other four vehicles.

    What were they all doing there? No one has any reason to visit this spot in the middle of nowhere. As you are pondering the reasons and looking into one of the car windows, you hear it. The unmistakable scream of a woman in terror. You know that sound. You have not heard it since the war. But this is not Korea, it is a desert valley in New Mexico.

    You look in the direction of the scream. Nothing! No sign of anyone. You can only surmise one thing.  What ever the terror is,  you can't see it.  It must be a terror from below. You grab your shotgun from behind the seat. You stuff your pockets with as many shells as you can and you start walking. It is time to find the others and what has happened to them. You are on guard and ready. Ready for fight if necessary. Ready for anything....or so you thought.

     

     

    We already have our initial framework working. We expect alpha access to be ready soon. We have already spent a great deal of time working on the mechanics and are very confident in the play movement and weapon usage. We still have many tasks, on our road map, to polish. Such as: 3D modeling, rigging, menu system, achievement tracking, game delivery, and audio. With adequate funding, we do not anticipate many challenges with the completion of these planned tasks.

       


      We have modeled our system requirements based off of the Unity Engine and recommended specifications. They are subject to change based on further development.

      Unity Recommends:

      OS: Windows 7 SP1+, macOS 10.12+, Ubuntu 16.04+
      Graphics card with DX10 (shader model 4.0) capabilities.
      CPU: SSE2 instruction set support.

      We recommend:

      Desktop PC or Mac.
      Windows 7 64-bit or Mac OS X 10.12+, Ubuntu 16.04+
      Quad-core Intel or AMD processor, 2.5 GHz or faster.
      NVIDIA GeForce 470 GTX or AMD Radeon 6870 HD series card or higher.
      8 GB RAM.

       

       

      We know that playing games does not necessarily equate to being a savant at video game creation. For this reason we have been honing our skills within coding, game design, 3d modeling, texturing, animation, etc. With all of our combined experience we feel confident in our ability to tackle any potential challenges we may face as we work on our passion project. We want to thank you in advance for your support. We look forward to creating not only a great game and great gaming company, but also a great community.

      We welcome any and all feedback and constructive criticism as we strive to be better people, developers, and fellow gamers.

       

       

       

       

      Private Investigator - Antonio "Tony" Mora

      Although born in New Mexico, Tony grew up on the streets of Chicago. His mother,  Carmen, worked for a large hotel. His father, Miguel, worked tirelessly in sanitation. They worked themselves to death both figuratively and literally.

      Before becoming a private eye, Tony served with law enforcement. One of only a few Hispanic cops on the lower east side, he spent many years chasing bad guys linked to, and including, the notorious gangster Al Capone.

      Tony learned all too well where lead lands after it exits the barrel of a gun. He lost his best compañero in the line of duty.

      As he approached the minimum retirement age, he hoped for a quieter life. He hoped to return to his roots. So when his grandfather's small farm went up for sale in NM he jumped at the chance to return to his birth place. He longed for the colorful sunsets, slower pace, and delectable food. He could not wait to see the strings if chili’s swinging in the wind as they hung from every porch in town. He could not wait to ease in a new career of tracking down deadbeat debtors, serving court documents, and following the occasional wayward wife.

      All of this fell into place on his 46th birthday, November 18, 1957.  Almost two years into his dream job, came that fateful day. The day he followed Mrs. Sally Johansson several miles of town…

      Journalist - Carol Martin

      In journalism you have to start somewhere. And for Carol, that somewhere was the middle of nowhere New Mexico. Oh sure, the people were great, but the small town feel was a far cry from the hustle and bustle of New York City, her birth place.

      Carol studied communication and journalism at Stanford University, receiving a Bachelor of Arts Degree in 1958. Rather than stick around in school and work toward a Master of Arts  or Ph.D Degree, Carol knew she had to 'get out there' and make a name for herself. As a woman, journalism jobs were scarce. It was going to be as tough, or tougher, to make it as a reporter as it was to get accepted into the journalism program. She did not mind most of the all-male faculty, but she knew that she would have to work twice as hard to make her mark.

      Her hero was Marguerite Higgins, the Pulitzer Prize winner for international reporting in 1951 but news was a man's world. Men like Edward R. Murrow and Walter Cronkite where becoming household names in news. She kept telling herself that the newspaper beat was only stepping stone. Television was where she wanted to be. But she had to pay her dues. She had to break open a big story. And what better place to start than the rustic backdrop of the birthplace of the atomic age?

      When the New Mexico State Record, a newspaper in Santa Fe, opened a reporting position that focused on New Mexico Joint Guided Missile Test Range, Holloman Air Force Base, and the Los Alamos National Laboratory she was intrigued. When she found out that the paper planned to resell these stories to nationally and internationally syndicated periodicals, she knew this was her chance at getting  recognition.

      She was following a tip she had been given. A tip that there was a military cover up. A tip that would make her career. A tip that lead her several miles out of town….

      Scientist - Lily Sato

      After the Japanese invasion of Manchuria, Lily's parents decided to leave Japan. They had come to America seeking a new life. They embraced their new country. But that embrace and support would be tested as her parents were interned at the Granada War Relocation Center in Colorado during World War II.

      In 1946, after being released, the family headed South. Her Father, Koya, was a brilliant man. He and Lily's mother, Rika, taught their three children as often as they could. Lily showed a great learning ability and an affinity for the sciences. But her vast knowledge and beauty did not stop Koya from teaching her how to take care of herself. She was small by most standards in America, but her attitude and wits more than made up for what she lacked in size.

      After graduating from high school, she had taken advantage of a job opening as a lab assistant at the Sandia  Corporation. After a couple of years, she officially became the scientist she had always dreamed of. That is, until she found herself on her way back from meeting in El Paso, several miles from the nearest town, with a small group of strangers looking at something very curious. Her knowledge of the sciences was about to be tested…in ways she never imagined.

      Military Police Officer - Dox Williams

      Dox was named after Dox Thrash, an artist and inventor. His father, Archibald, was a military man. His mother, Faith, was homemaker and made the best ginger cookies this side of the Mississippi river - no matter which side of the river she was on. The family moved from one military base to another. Never staying put too long. Dox became very close to his sister Minnie, until her untimely death from cancer in 1953.

      It wasn't easy being a Black Military Policeman, serving on and off of Holloman Air Force Base. His jurisdiction extended to military personnel outside of the base (so long as he informed local law enforcement). They pretty much ignored him and he pretty much ignored them. He worked mostly alone and Dox liked it that way. Funding for the MPs had been cut back and the luxury of a partner was not something Dox wanted or needed.

      He was a tough man. Nothing frightened him. The size of his boxing opponent, the race of the drunkard, nor the knife wielding teenage punk even raised his eyebrow. He was good in a fight, and he knew it. A black man, even in uniform, was not often respected. But his size and attitude demanded respect. This is why Captain Mallory sent him out looking for Sergeant Charles "Charlie" McDonald that day.

      Charlie's wife had reported him as missing. They had a spat the night before. Charlie was known for high-tailing it into the surrounding desert. Often hanging out in old mining towns. Charlie had been given a lot of leeway because of his service record. But Dox knew that this might be the last time the military would put up with his unscheduled absences. Dox did not particularly like Charlie, but he knew what war can do to a man so he had cut him some slack on more than one occasion. He found Charlie's car several miles out of town, off the road, near one of the small, abandoned towns. The car was not all by itself. It had company.…

Explore massive underground tunnel networks with the intent to rid the world of these man-made monsters.  Players will be able to choose from one of three game modes that will fit their play style and allow them to progress through the game at their own pace.The brain child of a dedicated game development team, Terror From Below is our passion. A true blood-pumping-adrenaline rush-fight-to-the-death.

story:
The Story:

A group of friends head up to the forest on, what looks to be, a weekend get away. When they wake up, Xio is missing. To make matters worse, news of an infectious disease spreads leaving you to wander if Xio is even still alive. Follow clues and discover the hidden secrets behind the global outbreak. Go it alone or with friends. The choice is up to you in this multiplayer, open-world, zombie, survival game. Will you overcome all obstacles on your quest for answers?

"Where is Xio"?

You awaken from a deep sleep, slowly blink your eyes to discover you had fallen asleep in a tent. When was the last time you went camping? Confusion begins to instill as you unzip the tent, cold air fills your lungs. "Where am I? How did I get here?"

 

A shiver courses through your entire body as you realize you are in the middle of nowhere, no clue how you got here, it is freezing. "Why are my clothes gone?"

 

Through the silencce you begin to hear the faint sound of warning. "Warning for what?" Uncertainty guides you towards the hood of your truck, condition not as you left it.

bzzz... bzzz... this is the emergency broadcast system. This is NOT a test, repeat, this is NOT a test. Citizens are advised to take the following steps:  Stay alert to news media events or local emergency alert notifications. Avoid contact with the infected, if evacuation isn't possible, move indoors and initiate in-place sheltering. Use a gasmask or if none are available, cover your mouth and nose with a clean cloth that has been soaked with a solution of 1 cup water and 1 tablespoon of baking soda. Also, cover bare skin and make sure that cuts and abrasions are covered. If exposed, remove clothes and seal in a plastic bag, immediately wash off using copious amounts of  warm soapy water or a diluted 10 to 1 bleach solution. Since biological agents are being used to combat the outbreak, be sure to shut the windows and air-intake vents to your shelter. If possible, stay upwind from the source of biological  agents. Seek medical attention as quickly as possible after coming in contact with the infected or a biological agent. If evacuated, do NOT return home until local authorities say it is safe. Upon arriving home, open up all the windows and doors to provide natural ventilation. Do not attempt to try mechanical ventilation, such as: electric fans, as an explosive threat may be present. Find out from local authorities how to clean up your land and property. Discard food and water supplies that were impacted by the hazardous material contamination.  This is the emergency broadcast system...bzzz...bzzz"

"Infectious disease, is that what happened to my clothes? Have I been infected? How long have I been here?" Thoughts run rampant through your mind as you begin searching  for more clues. 

 

 

"What's this, a note? Xio left a note, she was here? Should I wait for her to come back? How long has she been gone? Should I go looking for her? So many questions, I need to find answers!"

 

The Game:

In Xio: Survival you play as one of five available characters, you begin your journey at a basecamp, with no clothes, lack of supplies, and little knowledge when it comes to the wilderness. You have the ability to create a private server and invite friends, or join a multiplayer server to test what a real-life outbreak feels like. Trust is hard to come by, finding allies can be nearly impossible. All players roam the Alaskan wilderness freely. 

Xio: Survival will be a player-driven community based experience, where the development team will take all criticism, negative/positive feedback we receive, to improve the game. We strive to develop the best survival experience for players that we possibly can. As a small team, we need our community to be as vocal as possible. Support comes in many forms, whether financial, constructive, or by social media distribution. We appreciate all of the support we've received and continue to receive.

 

The Survival:


Starting in Xio: Survival, the temperature outside is sporadic, you begin with no clothes so the journey sets in immediately. You're given a starting backpack, cloth, a wooden axe, hunting knife and, a rope. These tools must be used wisely and carefully.

Before you leave the starting camp, you have many choices and directions you can take. Follow the letters left from Xio, roam free, encounter other survivors on the map or adventure into the woods.

Resources are limited, so prepare yourself before nightfall.

 

Points Of Interests:

The current map of Xio: Survival is described in three areas. The Southern most part of the island, the middle residential area and the harsh North. You'll find the heart of the outbreak further South. The Northern part of the island has yet to be affected by the outbreak, however the risk of freezing to death increases.

This game features; police stations, underground subway stations, markets, stores and hospitals, residential areas, deep wilderness, and much more to come.

 

Home Building:

You will find homes scattered along the map of Xio: Survival, these small shacks are able to be claimed, fortified and lived in. Your home is only safe until discovered. Do your best to keep up with land, farms and protections, you never know who wants to take it for themselves.

Craft workbenches, furnaces and other equipment needed for fortifications, weapons and ammo.

Players who want your land, can destroy your property, break into your home and steal it from you. Defend it at all costs.

 

Hunting:

You can't depend on looting homes and buildings down South forever, live up North, hunt the wild and be amongst the hidden. Taking advantage of all natural resources can be your best chance at survival.

 

The Community:

You are our lifeline.

Xio: Survival is a community driven game. Our development team works extremely hard and is very active on our community channels. All of the backers will gain access to speak with lead developers including a potential inside look at our live streams during working hours. We are consistently available on our Discord channel and are prepared to answer questions and accept constructive feedback.

To join our discord server - click here: https://discord.gg/e5KQdDRG

Also, make sure to subscribe and share our YouTube channel to help us grow - click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHR8YWMZlEuMX7...

We are also open to creator programs and partnerships for those selected creators with likeminded ideas.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Xio fans, we need your help in continuing development. Our team has devoted countless hours to provide a lot of content in a short amount of time. We look forward to continuing to add more and making this your go-to survival experience. That being said, in order to keep working at this pace we need funding. Funding will go towards the progression of the game. Ultimately if we receive the funding needed we will continue to devote most of our time to the production of this game. Unfortunately, if we do not receive the funding needed we will need to devote time to something more financially productive, this will slow the final release of the game drastically. We are excited for you to join this survival experience and nobody likes to wait years for a game to release. Help us get it to you sooner! 

 

The Impact

Our team of developers are devoted to providing quality content, in efficient time. We are posting daily updates to keep you informed in the development process. We have provided a chat and voice chat channel on our discord if you'd like to speak with us or provide feedback. If we are online, we are approachable and we look forward to continuing this as we move forward together. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are presenting a game that is fully playable at this point however, we can make it better. That being said the risks are limited. We will be releasing an early access version of the game in the coming months regardless. The Challenge we are facing is the time that has been dedicated without compensation.  Funding can ensure that development continues without postponement.

Other Ways You Can Help

We cannot stress this enough, support of all forms does not go unnoticed. We need support in the form of getting the word out to others about this gaming experience. Feel free to utilize the Indie share tools provided.
story_txt:
The Story:
A group of friends head up to the forest on, what looks to be, a weekend get away. When they wake up, Xio is missing. To make matters worse, news of an infectious disease spreads leaving you to wander if Xio is even still alive. Follow clues and discover the hidden secrets behind the global outbreak. Go it alone or with friends. The choice is up to you in this multiplayer, open-world, zombie, survival game. Will you overcome all obstacles on your quest for answers?
"Where is Xio"?
You awaken from a deep sleep, slowly blink your eyes to discover you had fallen asleep in a tent. When was the last time you went camping? Confusion begins to instill as you unzip the tent, cold air fills your lungs. "Where am I? How did I get here?"
 


A shiver courses through your entire body as you realize you are in the middle of nowhere, no clue how you got here, it is freezing. "Why are my clothes gone?"
 
Through the silencce you begin to hear the faint sound of warning. "Warning for what?" Uncertainty guides you towards the hood of your truck, condition not as you left it.

bzzz... bzzz... this is the emergency broadcast system. This is NOT a test, repeat, this is NOT a test. Citizens are advised to take the following steps:  Stay alert to news media events or local emergency alert notifications. Avoid contact with the infected, if evacuation isn't possible, move indoors and initiate in-place sheltering. Use a gasmask or if none are available, cover your mouth and nose with a clean cloth that has been soaked with a solution of 1 cup water and 1 tablespoon of baking soda. Also, cover bare skin and make sure that cuts and abrasions are covered. If exposed, remove clothes and seal in a plastic bag, immediately wash off using copious amounts of  warm soapy water or a diluted 10 to 1 bleach solution. Since biological agents are being used to combat the outbreak, be sure to shut the windows and air-intake vents to your shelter. If possible, stay upwind from the source of biological  agents. Seek medical attention as quickly as possible after coming in contact with the infected or a biological agent. If evacuated, do NOT return home until local authorities say it is safe. Upon arriving home, open up all the windows and doors to provide natural ventilation. Do not attempt to try mechanical ventilation, such as: electric fans, as an explosive threat may be present. Find out from local authorities how to clean up your land and property. Discard food and water supplies that were impacted by the hazardous material contamination.  This is the emergency broadcast system...bzzz...bzzz"
"Infectious disease, is that what happened to my clothes? Have I been infected? How long have I been here?" Thoughts run rampant through your mind as you begin searching  for more clues. 
 

 
"What's this, a note? Xio left a note, she was here? Should I wait for her to come back? How long has she been gone? Should I go looking for her? So many questions, I need to find answers!"
 
The Game:
In Xio: Survival you play as one of five available characters, you begin your journey at a basecamp, with no clothes, lack of supplies, and little knowledge when it comes to the wilderness. You have the ability to create a private server and invite friends, or join a multiplayer server to test what a real-life outbreak feels like. Trust is hard to come by, finding allies can be nearly impossible. All players roam the Alaskan wilderness freely. 
Xio: Survival will be a player-driven community based experience, where the development team will take all criticism, negative/positive feedback we receive, to improve the game. We strive to develop the best survival experience for players that we possibly can. As a small team, we need our community to be as vocal as possible. Support comes in many forms, whether financial, constructive, or by social media distribution. We appreciate all of the support we've received and continue to receive.

 
The Survival:
Starting in Xio: Survival, the temperature outside is sporadic, you begin with no clothes so the journey sets in immediately. You're given a starting backpack, cloth, a wooden axe, hunting knife and, a rope. These tools must be used wisely and carefully.
Before you leave the starting camp, you have many choices and directions you can take. Follow the letters left from Xio, roam free, encounter other survivors on the map or adventure into the woods.
Resources are limited, so prepare yourself before nightfall.
 
Points Of Interests:
The current map of Xio: Survival is described in three areas. The Southern most part of the island, the middle residential area and the harsh North. You'll find the heart of the outbreak further South. The Northern part of the island has yet to be affected by the outbreak, however the risk of freezing to death increases.
This game features; police stations, underground subway stations, markets, stores and hospitals, residential areas, deep wilderness, and much more to come.

 
Home Building:
You will find homes scattered along the map of Xio: Survival, these small shacks are able to be claimed, fortified and lived in. Your home is only safe until discovered. Do your best to keep up with land, farms and protections, you never know who wants to take it for themselves.
Craft workbenches, furnaces and other equipment needed for fortifications, weapons and ammo.
Players who want your land, can destroy your property, break into your home and steal it from you. Defend it at all costs.




 
Hunting:
You can't depend on looting homes and buildings down South forever, live up North, hunt the wild and be amongst the hidden. Taking advantage of all natural resources can be your best chance at survival.



 
The Community:
You are our lifeline.
Xio: Survival is a community driven game. Our development team works extremely hard and is very active on our community channels. All of the backers will gain access to speak with lead developers including a potential inside look at our live streams during working hours. We are consistently available on our Discord channel and are prepared to answer questions and accept constructive feedback.
To join our discord server - click here: https://discord.gg/e5KQdDRG
Also, make sure to subscribe and share our YouTube channel to help us grow - click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHR8YWMZlEuMX7...
We are also open to creator programs and partnerships for those selected creators with likeminded ideas.
